Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION: UNDERSTANDING SAVED DATA ===\n") # First, check what files are available in the workspace print("Files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print(" No workspace directory found") # Check if the research results JSON file exists and inspect its structure research_file = 'workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_research_phase1.json' if os.path.exists(research_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING RESEARCH RESULTS FILE ===\n") print(f"File: {research_file}") with open(research_file, 'r') as f: research_data = json.load(f) print("\nTop-level keys in research file:") for key, value in research_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Inspect the structure of successful and failed sources if 'successful_sources' in research_data: print(f"\nSuccessful sources: {len(research_data['successful_sources'])}") if research_data['successful_sources']: print("Sample successful source structure:") sample = research_data['successful_sources'][0] for key, value in sample.items(): print(f" {key}: {value}") if 'failed_sources' in research_data: print(f"\nFailed sources: {len(research_data['failed_sources'])}") if research_data['failed_sources']: print("Sample failed source:") for i, failed in enumerate(research_data['failed_sources'][:3]): print(f" {i+1}. {failed}") else: print(f"\nResearch file not found: {research_file}") # Check for HTML files that might have been saved despite the error html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] if os.path.exists('workspace') else [] print(f"\n=== HTML FILES FOUND: {len(html_files)} ===\n") for html_file in html_files: html_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(html_path) print(f"HTML File: {html_file}") print(f"Size: {file_size:,} bytes") # Determine which artist this file belongs to if 'fiona_apple' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' print(f"Artist: {artist}") # Read first few lines to verify content with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: first_lines = [f.readline().strip() for _ in range(3)] print("Content preview:") for i, line in enumerate(first_lines, 1): preview = line[:80] + "..." if len(line) > 80 else line print(f" {i}: {preview}") # Quick content check for key indicators with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() content_lower = content.lower() indicators = { 'has_discography': 'discography' in content_lower, 'has_album_mentions': 'album' in content_lower, 'has_1990s_years': any(year in content for year in ['1990', '1991', '1992', '1993', '1994', '1995', '1996', '1997', '1998']), 'has_tables': '<table' in content_lower } print("Content indicators:") for indicator, present in indicators.items(): status = "âœ“" if present else "âœ—" print(f" {status} {indicator}: {present}") # Look for specific album names based on artist if artist == 'Fiona Apple': album_searches = ['tidal', 'when the pawn'] elif artist == 'Paula Cole': album_searches = ['harbinger', 'this fire'] else: album_searches = [] if album_searches: albums_found = [album for album in album_searches if album in content_lower] print(f" Known albums found: {albums_found}") print() print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION COMPLETE ===\n") print("Key findings:") print(f"1. HTML files saved: {len(html_files)}") if html_files: print("2. Despite the variable name error, HTML content was successfully downloaded") print("3. Ready to proceed with fixed parsing logic") else: print("2. No HTML files found - need to re-download content") print("\nNext step: Fix the variable name bug and parse the HTML content for album information")
Execution Output
Code Output: === WORKSPACE INSPECTION: UNDERSTANDING SAVED DATA === Files in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html (247,584 bytes) - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html (322,582 bytes) - fiona_apple_paula_cole_research_phase1.json (859 bytes) - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html (188,126 bytes) === INSPECTING RESEARCH RESULTS FILE === File: workspace_f46b4380-207e-4434-820b-f32ce04ae2a4/fiona_apple_paula_cole_research_phase1.json Top-level keys in research file: research_timestamp: 2025-08-03 04:09:51 target_criteria: Albums released before January 1, 1999 artists_researched: List with 2 items successful_sources: List with 0 items failed_sources: List with 4 items albums_found: List with 0 items Successful sources: 0 Failed sources: 4 Sample failed source: 1. {'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'error': "name 'content_text' is not defined"} 2. {'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple_discography', 'error': "name 'content_text' is not defined"} 3. {'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole', 'error': "name 'content_text' is not defined"} === HTML FILES FOUND: 3 === HTML File: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Size: 247,584 bytes Artist: Paula Cole Content preview: 1: <!DOCTYPE html> 2: <html class="client-nojs vector-feature-language-in-header-enabled vector-featur... 3: <head> Execution error: NameError: name 'content' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 90, in <module> File "<string>", line 90, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'content' is not defined
tester
2025-08-03 04:10:51
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The workspace inspection code has another variable name error on line 90. While the code successfully identified that HTML files were downloaded (3 files totaling ~758KB) and confirmed the previous variable bug was the issue, it crashes when trying to analyze years in the content due to 'content' being undefined. The inspection reveals valuable progress: (1) HTML files are successfully saved for both artists including Fiona Apple's discography page, (2) The research JSON shows the previous 'content_text' error affected all 4 sources, (3) Files contain substantial content (247-322KB each) indicating good data availability. **PLAN** alignment: Data collection is complete, but parsing is blocked by variable errors. Immediate fix: The variable 'content' on line 90 should be defined earlier in the loop - move the 'with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read()' line before the content analysis section. The HTML files are ready for album extraction once this bug is fixed.
Python Code python
import os import json print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION: UNDERSTANDING SAVED DATA ===\n") # First, check what files are available in the workspace print("Files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') for file in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print(" No workspace directory found") # Check if the research results JSON file exists and inspect its structure research_file = 'workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_research_phase1.json' if os.path.exists(research_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING RESEARCH RESULTS FILE ===\n") print(f"File: {research_file}") with open(research_file, 'r') as f: research_data = json.load(f) print("\nTop-level keys in research file:") for key, value in research_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Inspect the structure of successful and failed sources if 'successful_sources' in research_data: print(f"\nSuccessful sources: {len(research_data['successful_sources'])}") if research_data['successful_sources']: print("Sample successful source structure:") sample = research_data['successful_sources'][0] for key, value in sample.items(): print(f" {key}: {value}") if 'failed_sources' in research_data: print(f"\nFailed sources: {len(research_data['failed_sources'])}") if research_data['failed_sources']: print("Sample failed source:") for i, failed in enumerate(research_data['failed_sources'][:3]): print(f" {i+1}. {failed}") else: print(f"\nResearch file not found: {research_file}") # Check for HTML files that might have been saved despite the error html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] if os.path.exists('workspace') else [] print(f"\n=== HTML FILES FOUND: {len(html_files)} ===\n") for html_file in html_files: html_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(html_path) print(f"HTML File: {html_file}") print(f"Size: {file_size:,} bytes") # Determine which artist this file belongs to if 'fiona_apple' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' print(f"Artist: {artist}") # Read first few lines to verify content with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: first_lines = [f.readline().strip() for _ in range(3)] print("Content preview:") for i, line in enumerate(first_lines, 1): preview = line[:80] + "..." if len(line) > 80 else line print(f" {i}: {preview}") # Quick content check for key indicators with open(html_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() content_lower = content.lower() indicators = { 'has_discography': 'discography' in content_lower, 'has_album_mentions': 'album' in content_lower, 'has_1990s_years': any(year in content for year in ['1990', '1991', '1992', '1993', '1994', '1995', '1996', '1997', '1998']), 'has_tables': '<table' in content_lower } print("Content indicators:") for indicator, present in indicators.items(): status = "âœ“" if present else "âœ—" print(f" {status} {indicator}: {present}") # Look for specific album names based on artist if artist == 'Fiona Apple': album_searches = ['tidal', 'when the pawn'] elif artist == 'Paula Cole': album_searches = ['harbinger', 'this fire'] else: album_searches = [] if album_searches: albums_found = [album for album in album_searches if album in content_lower] print(f" Known albums found: {albums_found}") print() print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION COMPLETE ===\n") print("Key findings:") print(f"1. HTML files saved: {len(html_files)}") if html_files: print("2. Despite the variable name error, HTML content was successfully downloaded") print("3. Ready to proceed with fixed parsing logic") else: print("2. No HTML files found - need to re-download content") print("\nNext step: Fix the variable name bug and parse the HTML content for album information")
Execution Output
Code Output: === WORKSPACE INSPECTION: UNDERSTANDING SAVED DATA === Files in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html (247,584 bytes) - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html (322,582 bytes) - fiona_apple_paula_cole_research_phase1.json (859 bytes) - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html (188,126 bytes) === INSPECTING RESEARCH RESULTS FILE === File: workspace_f46b4380-207e-4434-820b-f32ce04ae2a4/fiona_apple_paula_cole_research_phase1.json Top-level keys in research file: research_timestamp: 2025-08-03 04:09:51 target_criteria: Albums released before January 1, 1999 artists_researched: List with 2 items successful_sources: List with 0 items failed_sources: List with 4 items albums_found: List with 0 items Successful sources: 0 Failed sources: 4 Sample failed source: 1. {'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'error': "name 'content_text' is not defined"} 2. {'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple_discography', 'error': "name 'content_text' is not defined"} 3. {'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole', 'error': "name 'content_text' is not defined"} === HTML FILES FOUND: 3 === HTML File: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Size: 247,584 bytes Artist: Paula Cole Content preview: 1: <!DOCTYPE html> 2: <html class="client-nojs vector-feature-language-in-header-enabled vector-featur... 3: <head> Execution error: NameError: name 'content' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 90, in <module> File "<string>", line 90, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'content' is not defined
developer
2025-08-03 04:11:54
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FIXED) ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Sources: Wikipedia pages with corrected variable handling\n") # First, check if we already have HTML files from previous attempts print("=== CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES ===\n") existing_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if file.endswith('.html'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) existing_files.append({ 'filename': file, 'path': file_path, 'size': file_size }) print(f"Found existing HTML file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") if existing_files: print(f"\nFound {len(existing_files)} existing HTML files. Using these for analysis.\n") else: print("No existing HTML files found. Will need to download fresh content.\n") # Download fresh content if needed headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } target_urls = [ ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple'), ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple_discography'), ('Paula Cole', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole') ] for artist, url in target_urls: try: print(f"Downloading {artist} page: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) existing_files.append({ 'filename': filename, 'path': filepath, 'size': len(response.text) }) print(f" âœ“ Downloaded: {filename} ({len(response.text):,} bytes)") else: print(f" âœ— Failed: Status {response.status_code}") time.sleep(2) except Exception as e: print(f" âœ— Error: {str(e)}") print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results structure research_results = { 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'albums_found': [], 'sources_analyzed': [] } # Process each HTML file for file_info in existing_files: filename = file_info['filename'] filepath = file_info['path'] print(f"--- Analyzing {filename} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' print(f"Artist: {artist}") print(f"File size: {file_info['size']:,} bytes") # Read and parse HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for discography sections discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_sections)}") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Tables found: {len(tables)}") # Analyze tables for album data album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text() table_text_lower = table_text.lower() # Check if table contains album/year information for 1990s has_90s_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text_lower for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release']) if has_90s_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_90s_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") print(f"Potential album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from promising tables albums_from_this_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Process table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) years_in_row = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years_in_row = [int(year) for year in years_in_row if 1990 <= int(year) <= 1998] if target_years_in_row: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'source_file': filename, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Try to extract album title (usually the longest meaningful text) potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short text, or obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 2 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and not cell_text.lower() in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles, 'release_year': min(target_years_in_row) if target_years_in_row else None }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") # Add to albums list if it looks like a legitimate album if potential_titles and (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation)): albums_from_this_source.append(potential_album_info) print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") # Store analysis results source_analysis = { 'filename': filename, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_sections), 'total_tables': len(tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_this_source) } research_results['sources_analyzed'].append(source_analysis) research_results['albums_found'].extend(albums_from_this_source) print(f"\nAlbums extracted from {filename}: {len(albums_from_this_source)}") print() print(f"=== COMPILATION OF PRE-1999 ALBUMS ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums = sorted(research_results['albums_found'], key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['release_year'] or 0)) print(f"Total albums found: {len(all_albums)}\n") # Display results by artist for artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums if album['artist'] == artist] print(f"--- {artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): year = album['release_year'] titles = album['potential_titles'] title = titles[0] if titles else 'Title needs verification' print(f"{i}. **{year}**: {title}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" All potential titles: {titles}") print(f" Raw data: {album['cell_data']}") print() # Create final summary final_summary = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_period': 'Before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['release_year'], 'title': album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification', 'all_title_candidates': album['potential_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'] } for album in all_albums ] } # Save complete results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"=== RESEARCH COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Final results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json") print(f"\n**SUMMARY**:") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Total: {final_summary['total_albums_found']} albums") if final_summary['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE LIST**:") for album in final_summary['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} - {album['year']}: {album['title']}") print(f"\nResearch methodology: Wikipedia page analysis with HTML table parsing") print(f"Source reliability: High (Wikipedia with structured discography data)")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FIXED) === Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999) Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole Sources: Wikipedia pages with corrected variable handling === CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES === Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html (247,584 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html (322,582 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html (188,126 bytes) Found 3 existing HTML files. Using these for analysis. === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA === --- Analyzing en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html --- Artist: Paula Cole File size: 247,584 bytes Page title: Paula Cole - Wikipedia Execution error: NameError: name 'heading_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 121, in <module> File "<string>", line 121, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'heading_text' is not defined
tester
2025-08-03 04:11:54
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Another variable name error prevents the code from completing the album analysis. The code successfully identified existing HTML files (3 files totaling ~758KB from Wikipedia) and began parsing, but crashes on line 121 with 'NameError: name 'heading_text' is not defined'. The error occurs during discography section analysis where 'heading_text' is referenced in a generator expression but was defined inside the loop. **PLAN** alignment: 50% - HTML content is available and parsing logic is sound, but variable scope errors prevent album extraction. The code shows good progress: found discography sections, identified tables, and has the right approach to extract 1990s album data. Immediate fix needed: Move the 'heading_text = heading.get_text().lower()' assignment before the generator expression that uses it, or restructure the logic to avoid the variable scope issue. The HTML files contain the needed discography data and are ready for successful parsing once this bug is resolved.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FIXED) ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Sources: Wikipedia pages with corrected variable handling\n") # First, check if we already have HTML files from previous attempts print("=== CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES ===\n") existing_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if file.endswith('.html'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) existing_files.append({ 'filename': file, 'path': file_path, 'size': file_size }) print(f"Found existing HTML file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") if existing_files: print(f"\nFound {len(existing_files)} existing HTML files. Using these for analysis.\n") else: print("No existing HTML files found. Will need to download fresh content.\n") # Download fresh content if needed headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } target_urls = [ ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple'), ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple_discography'), ('Paula Cole', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole') ] for artist, url in target_urls: try: print(f"Downloading {artist} page: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) existing_files.append({ 'filename': filename, 'path': filepath, 'size': len(response.text) }) print(f" âœ“ Downloaded: {filename} ({len(response.text):,} bytes)") else: print(f" âœ— Failed: Status {response.status_code}") time.sleep(2) except Exception as e: print(f" âœ— Error: {str(e)}") print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results structure research_results = { 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'albums_found': [], 'sources_analyzed': [] } # Process each HTML file for file_info in existing_files: filename = file_info['filename'] filepath = file_info['path'] print(f"--- Analyzing {filename} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' print(f"Artist: {artist}") print(f"File size: {file_info['size']:,} bytes") # Read and parse HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for discography sections discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_sections)}") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Tables found: {len(tables)}") # Analyze tables for album data album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text() table_text_lower = table_text.lower() # Check if table contains album/year information for 1990s has_90s_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text_lower for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release']) if has_90s_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_90s_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") print(f"Potential album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from promising tables albums_from_this_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Process table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) years_in_row = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years_in_row = [int(year) for year in years_in_row if 1990 <= int(year) <= 1998] if target_years_in_row: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'source_file': filename, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Try to extract album title (usually the longest meaningful text) potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short text, or obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 2 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and not cell_text.lower() in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles, 'release_year': min(target_years_in_row) if target_years_in_row else None }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") # Add to albums list if it looks like a legitimate album if potential_titles and (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation)): albums_from_this_source.append(potential_album_info) print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") # Store analysis results source_analysis = { 'filename': filename, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_sections), 'total_tables': len(tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_this_source) } research_results['sources_analyzed'].append(source_analysis) research_results['albums_found'].extend(albums_from_this_source) print(f"\nAlbums extracted from {filename}: {len(albums_from_this_source)}") print() print(f"=== COMPILATION OF PRE-1999 ALBUMS ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums = sorted(research_results['albums_found'], key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['release_year'] or 0)) print(f"Total albums found: {len(all_albums)}\n") # Display results by artist for artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums if album['artist'] == artist] print(f"--- {artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): year = album['release_year'] titles = album['potential_titles'] title = titles[0] if titles else 'Title needs verification' print(f"{i}. **{year}**: {title}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" All potential titles: {titles}") print(f" Raw data: {album['cell_data']}") print() # Create final summary final_summary = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_period': 'Before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['release_year'], 'title': album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification', 'all_title_candidates': album['potential_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'] } for album in all_albums ] } # Save complete results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"=== RESEARCH COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Final results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json") print(f"\n**SUMMARY**:") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Total: {final_summary['total_albums_found']} albums") if final_summary['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE LIST**:") for album in final_summary['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} - {album['year']}: {album['title']}") print(f"\nResearch methodology: Wikipedia page analysis with HTML table parsing") print(f"Source reliability: High (Wikipedia with structured discography data)")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FIXED) === Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999) Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole Sources: Wikipedia pages with corrected variable handling === CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES === Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html (247,584 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html (322,582 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html (188,126 bytes) Found 3 existing HTML files. Using these for analysis. === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA === --- Analyzing en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html --- Artist: Paula Cole File size: 247,584 bytes Page title: Paula Cole - Wikipedia Execution error: NameError: name 'heading_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 121, in <module> File "<string>", line 121, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'heading_text' is not defined
developer
2025-08-03 04:12:59
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FINAL FIX) ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Sources: Wikipedia pages with all variable scope issues resolved\n") # First, check if we already have HTML files from previous attempts print("=== CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES ===\n") existing_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if file.endswith('.html'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) existing_files.append({ 'filename': file, 'path': file_path, 'size': file_size }) print(f"Found existing HTML file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") if existing_files: print(f"\nFound {len(existing_files)} existing HTML files. Using these for analysis.\n") else: print("No existing HTML files found. Will need to download fresh content.\n") # Download fresh content if needed headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } target_urls = [ ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple'), ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple_discography'), ('Paula Cole', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole') ] for artist, url in target_urls: try: print(f"Downloading {artist} page: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) existing_files.append({ 'filename': filename, 'path': filepath, 'size': len(response.text) }) print(f" âœ“ Downloaded: {filename} ({len(response.text):,} bytes)") else: print(f" âœ— Failed: Status {response.status_code}") time.sleep(2) except Exception as e: print(f" âœ— Error: {str(e)}") print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results structure research_results = { 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'albums_found': [], 'sources_analyzed': [] } # Process each HTML file for file_info in existing_files: filename = file_info['filename'] filepath = file_info['path'] print(f"--- Analyzing {filename} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' print(f"Artist: {artist}") print(f"File size: {file_info['size']:,} bytes") # Read and parse HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for discography sections - fix variable scope issue discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: current_heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() # Use unique variable name if any(word in current_heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_sections)}") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Tables found: {len(tables)}") # Analyze tables for album data album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text() table_text_lower = table_text.lower() # Check if table contains album/year information for 1990s has_90s_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text_lower for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release']) if has_90s_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_90s_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") print(f"Potential album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from promising tables albums_from_this_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Process table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) years_in_row = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years_in_row = [int(year) for year in years_in_row if 1990 <= int(year) <= 1998] if target_years_in_row: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'source_file': filename, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album current_row_text_lower = row_text.lower() # Use unique variable name studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in current_row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in current_row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in current_row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Try to extract album title (usually the longest meaningful text) potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short text, or obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 2 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and not cell_text.lower() in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles, 'release_year': min(target_years_in_row) if target_years_in_row else None }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") # Add to albums list if it looks like a legitimate album if potential_titles and (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation)): albums_from_this_source.append(potential_album_info) print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") # Store analysis results source_analysis = { 'filename': filename, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_sections), 'total_tables': len(tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_this_source) } research_results['sources_analyzed'].append(source_analysis) research_results['albums_found'].extend(albums_from_this_source) print(f"\nAlbums extracted from {filename}: {len(albums_from_this_source)}") print() print(f"=== COMPILATION OF PRE-1999 ALBUMS ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums = sorted(research_results['albums_found'], key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['release_year'] or 0)) print(f"Total albums found: {len(all_albums)}\n") # Display results by artist for target_artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums if album['artist'] == target_artist] print(f"--- {target_artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): year = album['release_year'] titles = album['potential_titles'] title = titles[0] if titles else 'Title needs verification' print(f"{i}. **{year}**: {title}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" All potential titles: {titles}") print(f" Raw data: {album['cell_data']}") print() # Create final summary final_summary = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_period': 'Before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['release_year'], 'title': album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification', 'all_title_candidates': album['potential_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'] } for album in all_albums ] } # Save complete results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"=== RESEARCH COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Final results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json") print(f"\n**SUMMARY**:") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Total: {final_summary['total_albums_found']} albums") if final_summary['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE LIST**:") for album in final_summary['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} - {album['year']}: {album['title']}") print(f"\nResearch methodology: Wikipedia page analysis with HTML table parsing") print(f"Source reliability: High (Wikipedia with structured discography data)") # Additional verification - look for known albums manually print(f"\n=== MANUAL VERIFICATION OF KNOWN ALBUMS ===\n") # Check for specific albums we know should exist known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': ['Tidal'], # Released 1996 'Paula Cole': ['Harbinger', 'This Fire'] # Harbinger 1994, This Fire 1996 } for artist, expected_albums in known_albums.items(): print(f"{artist} - Expected albums: {expected_albums}") found_titles = [album['title'].lower() for album in final_summary['detailed_albums'] if album['artist'] == artist] for expected in expected_albums: found = any(expected.lower() in title for title in found_titles) status = "âœ“" if found else "âœ—" print(f" {status} {expected}: {'Found' if found else 'Not found in extracted data'}") print()
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FINAL FIX) === Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999) Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole Sources: Wikipedia pages with all variable scope issues resolved === CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES === Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html (247,584 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html (322,582 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html (188,126 bytes) Found 3 existing HTML files. Using these for analysis. === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA === --- Analyzing en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html --- Artist: Paula Cole File size: 247,584 bytes Page title: Paula Cole - Wikipedia Execution error: NameError: name 'current_heading_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 121, in <module> File "<string>", line 121, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'current_heading_text' is not defined
tester
2025-08-03 04:12:59
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Variable scope error prevents album extraction from Wikipedia data. The code successfully identified 3 existing HTML files (758KB total) containing Fiona Apple and Paula Cole discography data, but crashes on line 121 with 'NameError: name 'heading_text' is not defined'. This occurs because 'heading_text' is defined inside a for loop but referenced in a generator expression where it's out of scope. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - Data collection is complete and parsing approach is correct, but variable scoping prevents album extraction. The code structure shows good progress: HTML files are loaded, page titles extracted, and the logic for finding discography sections and album tables is sound. Immediate fix: Replace the generator expression with a proper loop structure, or define 'heading_text' outside the scope issue. The Wikipedia HTML files contain the needed pre-1999 album information and are ready for successful parsing once this variable scoping bug is resolved.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FINAL FIX) ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Sources: Wikipedia pages with all variable scope issues resolved\n") # First, check if we already have HTML files from previous attempts print("=== CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES ===\n") existing_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if file.endswith('.html'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) existing_files.append({ 'filename': file, 'path': file_path, 'size': file_size }) print(f"Found existing HTML file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") if existing_files: print(f"\nFound {len(existing_files)} existing HTML files. Using these for analysis.\n") else: print("No existing HTML files found. Will need to download fresh content.\n") # Download fresh content if needed headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } target_urls = [ ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple'), ('Fiona Apple', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple_discography'), ('Paula Cole', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole') ] for artist, url in target_urls: try: print(f"Downloading {artist} page: {url}") response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) existing_files.append({ 'filename': filename, 'path': filepath, 'size': len(response.text) }) print(f" âœ“ Downloaded: {filename} ({len(response.text):,} bytes)") else: print(f" âœ— Failed: Status {response.status_code}") time.sleep(2) except Exception as e: print(f" âœ— Error: {str(e)}") print(f"\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results structure research_results = { 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'albums_found': [], 'sources_analyzed': [] } # Process each HTML file for file_info in existing_files: filename = file_info['filename'] filepath = file_info['path'] print(f"--- Analyzing {filename} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in filename.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' print(f"Artist: {artist}") print(f"File size: {file_info['size']:,} bytes") # Read and parse HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for discography sections - fix variable scope issue discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: current_heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() # Use unique variable name if any(word in current_heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_sections)}") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Tables found: {len(tables)}") # Analyze tables for album data album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text() table_text_lower = table_text.lower() # Check if table contains album/year information for 1990s has_90s_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text_lower for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release']) if has_90s_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_90s_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") print(f"Potential album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from promising tables albums_from_this_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Process table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) years_in_row = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years_in_row = [int(year) for year in years_in_row if 1990 <= int(year) <= 1998] if target_years_in_row: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'source_file': filename, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album current_row_text_lower = row_text.lower() # Use unique variable name studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in current_row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in current_row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in current_row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Try to extract album title (usually the longest meaningful text) potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short text, or obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 2 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and not cell_text.lower() in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles, 'release_year': min(target_years_in_row) if target_years_in_row else None }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") # Add to albums list if it looks like a legitimate album if potential_titles and (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation)): albums_from_this_source.append(potential_album_info) print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") # Store analysis results source_analysis = { 'filename': filename, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_sections), 'total_tables': len(tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_this_source) } research_results['sources_analyzed'].append(source_analysis) research_results['albums_found'].extend(albums_from_this_source) print(f"\nAlbums extracted from {filename}: {len(albums_from_this_source)}") print() print(f"=== COMPILATION OF PRE-1999 ALBUMS ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums = sorted(research_results['albums_found'], key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['release_year'] or 0)) print(f"Total albums found: {len(all_albums)}\n") # Display results by artist for target_artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums if album['artist'] == target_artist] print(f"--- {target_artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): year = album['release_year'] titles = album['potential_titles'] title = titles[0] if titles else 'Title needs verification' print(f"{i}. **{year}**: {title}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" All potential titles: {titles}") print(f" Raw data: {album['cell_data']}") print() # Create final summary final_summary = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_period': 'Before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['release_year'], 'title': album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification', 'all_title_candidates': album['potential_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'] } for album in all_albums ] } # Save complete results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"=== RESEARCH COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Final results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_albums.json") print(f"\n**SUMMARY**:") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_summary['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums found before 1999") print(f"- Total: {final_summary['total_albums_found']} albums") if final_summary['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE LIST**:") for album in final_summary['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} - {album['year']}: {album['title']}") print(f"\nResearch methodology: Wikipedia page analysis with HTML table parsing") print(f"Source reliability: High (Wikipedia with structured discography data)") # Additional verification - look for known albums manually print(f"\n=== MANUAL VERIFICATION OF KNOWN ALBUMS ===\n") # Check for specific albums we know should exist known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': ['Tidal'], # Released 1996 'Paula Cole': ['Harbinger', 'This Fire'] # Harbinger 1994, This Fire 1996 } for artist, expected_albums in known_albums.items(): print(f"{artist} - Expected albums: {expected_albums}") found_titles = [album['title'].lower() for album in final_summary['detailed_albums'] if album['artist'] == artist] for expected in expected_albums: found = any(expected.lower() in title for title in found_titles) status = "âœ“" if found else "âœ—" print(f" {status} {expected}: {'Found' if found else 'Not found in extracted data'}") print()
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE DISCOGRAPHY RESEARCH: PRE-1999 ALBUMS (FINAL FIX) === Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999) Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole Sources: Wikipedia pages with all variable scope issues resolved === CHECKING EXISTING HTML FILES === Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html (247,584 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html (322,582 bytes) Found existing HTML file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html (188,126 bytes) Found 3 existing HTML files. Using these for analysis. === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA === --- Analyzing en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html --- Artist: Paula Cole File size: 247,584 bytes Page title: Paula Cole - Wikipedia Execution error: NameError: name 'current_heading_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 121, in <module> File "<string>", line 121, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'current_heading_text' is not defined
