2025-08-03 04:13:59
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 5)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE PRE-1999 ALBUMS: CLEAN IMPLEMENTATION ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Approach: Clean parsing without variable scope issues\n") # First, inspect workspace to understand available files print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") exit() workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") print(f"HTML files available: {len(html_files)}\n") for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f"- {html_file}: {file_size:,} bytes") if not html_files: print("No HTML files found. Need to download Wikipedia pages first.") exit() print("\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results all_albums_found = [] source_analysis = [] # Process each HTML file for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) print(f"--- Processing {html_file} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' continue print(f"Artist: {artist}") # Load and parse HTML with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_tag = soup.find('title') page_title = title_tag.get_text().strip() if title_tag else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find discography sections discography_headings = [] all_headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in all_headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() discography_keywords = ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums'] for keyword in discography_keywords: if keyword in heading_text: discography_headings.append({ 'text': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) break print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_headings)}") for section in discography_headings: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['text']}") # Find and analyze tables all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Total tables found: {len(all_tables)}") # Look for tables with 1990s years and album information album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() # Check for 1990s years (1990-1998) has_target_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) # Check for album-related keywords table_lower = table_text.lower() album_keywords = ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release'] has_album_content = sum(1 for keyword in album_keywords if keyword in table_lower) >= 2 if has_target_years and has_album_content: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'table': table }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album data *** ANALYZING ***") print(f"Relevant album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from relevant tables albums_from_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['table'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get headers header_cells = table.find_all('th') headers = [th.get_text().strip() for th in header_cells] print(f" Headers: {headers}") # Process data rows rows = table.find_all('tr') data_rows = rows[1:] if len(rows) > 1 else rows # Skip header if present for row_idx, row in enumerate(data_rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns cell_data = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_data) # Look for years in target range (1990-1998) year_matches = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years = [int(year) for year in year_matches if 1990 <= int(year) <= 1998] if target_years: print(f" Row {row_idx + 1}: {cell_data}") print(f" Target years found: {target_years}") # Identify album type row_lower = row_text.lower() is_studio = any(indicator in row_lower for indicator in ['studio album', 'album']) is_live = any(indicator in row_lower for indicator in ['live', 'concert']) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_lower for indicator in ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of']) # Extract potential album titles potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_data: # Skip years, short text, and obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 3 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and cell_text.lower() not in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp', 'ep']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio}, Live: {is_live}, Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Include if it's likely a studio album if potential_titles and (is_studio or (not is_live and not is_compilation)): album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'year': min(target_years), 'title': potential_titles[0], 'all_titles': potential_titles, 'source_file': html_file, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_data': cell_data, 'is_studio': is_studio, 'confidence': 'high' if is_studio else 'medium' } albums_from_source.append(album_info) print(f" *** ALBUM IDENTIFIED ***") print(f"\nAlbums found in {html_file}: {len(albums_from_source)}") all_albums_found.extend(albums_from_source) # Store source analysis source_analysis.append({ 'filename': html_file, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_headings), 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_source) }) print() print("=== FINAL RESULTS COMPILATION ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums_sorted = sorted(all_albums_found, key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'])) print(f"Total pre-1999 albums found: {len(all_albums_sorted)}\n") # Display by artist for target_artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums_sorted if album['artist'] == target_artist] print(f"--- {target_artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): confidence_icon = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" print(f"{i}. {confidence_icon} **{album['year']}**: {album['title']}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" Alternative titles: {album['all_titles']}") print(f" Raw data: {album['row_data']}") print() # Create comprehensive summary final_results = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'methodology': 'Wikipedia HTML parsing with table analysis', 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums_sorted), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'title': album['title'], 'alternative_titles': album['all_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'], 'confidence': album['confidence'] } for album in all_albums_sorted ], 'source_analysis': source_analysis } # Save results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print("=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Research completed: {final_results['research_completed']}") print(f"Total albums found: {final_results['total_albums_found']}") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums") if final_results['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE PRE-1999 ALBUM LIST**:") for album in final_results['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} ({album['year']}): {album['title']}") else: print("\nNo albums found in the target period.") print(f"\nDetailed results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json") print(f"\nSources analyzed:") for source in source_analysis: print(f" - {source['filename']}: {source['albums_extracted']} albums extracted") # Manual verification for known albums print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION CHECK ===\n") known_pre1999_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': ['Tidal'], # Released July 1996 'Paula Cole': ['Harbinger', 'This Fire'] # Harbinger 1994, This Fire 1996 } for artist, expected_albums in known_pre1999_albums.items(): found_titles = [album['title'].lower() for album in final_results['detailed_albums'] if album['artist'] == artist] print(f"{artist} - Expected albums: {expected_albums}") for expected in expected_albums: found = any(expected.lower() in title for title in found_titles) status = "âœ“ Found" if found else "âœ— Missing" print(f" {status}: {expected}") print()
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE PRE-1999 ALBUMS: CLEAN IMPLEMENTATION === Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999) Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole Approach: Clean parsing without variable scope issues === WORKSPACE INSPECTION === Total files in workspace: 4 HTML files available: 3 - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html: 247,584 bytes - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html: 322,582 bytes - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html: 188,126 bytes === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA === --- Processing en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html --- Artist: Paula Cole Page title: Paula Cole - Wikipedia Discography sections found: 2 - H2: Discography - H3: Studio albums Total tables found: 7 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_lower' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 103, in <module> File "<string>", line 103, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_lower' is not defined
tester
2025-08-03 04:13:59
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Another variable scope error prevents album extraction despite having all the necessary Wikipedia data. The code successfully identified 3 HTML files (758KB total) containing Fiona Apple and Paula Cole discography information, but crashes on line 121 with 'NameError: name 'table_lower' is not defined'. This variable scoping issue occurs in the generator expression when checking for album indicators in table text. **PLAN** alignment: 70% - HTML data is available, parsing logic is sound, but variable scope bugs prevent completion. The code shows the right approach: found discography sections, identified tables with 1990s data, and has proper album filtering logic. Immediate fix: Replace 'table_lower' with 'table_text_lower' which is properly defined, or restructure to avoid the generator expression scope issue. The Wikipedia files contain the needed pre-1999 album data and the parsing framework is ready - just needs this final variable reference correction to extract the albums successfully.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE PRE-1999 ALBUMS: CLEAN IMPLEMENTATION ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Approach: Clean parsing without variable scope issues\n") # First, inspect workspace to understand available files print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") exit() workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") print(f"HTML files available: {len(html_files)}\n") for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f"- {html_file}: {file_size:,} bytes") if not html_files: print("No HTML files found. Need to download Wikipedia pages first.") exit() print("\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results all_albums_found = [] source_analysis = [] # Process each HTML file for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) print(f"--- Processing {html_file} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' continue print(f"Artist: {artist}") # Load and parse HTML with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_tag = soup.find('title') page_title = title_tag.get_text().strip() if title_tag else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find discography sections discography_headings = [] all_headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in all_headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() discography_keywords = ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums'] for keyword in discography_keywords: if keyword in heading_text: discography_headings.append({ 'text': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) break print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_headings)}") for section in discography_headings: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['text']}") # Find and analyze tables all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Total tables found: {len(all_tables)}") # Look for tables with 1990s years and album information album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() # Check for 1990s years (1990-1998) has_target_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) # Check for album-related keywords table_lower = table_text.lower() album_keywords = ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release'] has_album_content = sum(1 for keyword in album_keywords if keyword in table_lower) >= 2 if has_target_years and has_album_content: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'table': table }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album data *** ANALYZING ***") print(f"Relevant album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from relevant tables albums_from_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['table'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get headers header_cells = table.find_all('th') headers = [th.get_text().strip() for th in header_cells] print(f" Headers: {headers}") # Process data rows rows = table.find_all('tr') data_rows = rows[1:] if len(rows) > 1 else rows # Skip header if present for row_idx, row in enumerate(data_rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns cell_data = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_data) # Look for years in target range (1990-1998) year_matches = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years = [int(year) for year in year_matches if 1990 <= int(year) <= 1998] if target_years: print(f" Row {row_idx + 1}: {cell_data}") print(f" Target years found: {target_years}") # Identify album type row_lower = row_text.lower() is_studio = any(indicator in row_lower for indicator in ['studio album', 'album']) is_live = any(indicator in row_lower for indicator in ['live', 'concert']) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_lower for indicator in ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of']) # Extract potential album titles potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_data: # Skip years, short text, and obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 3 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and cell_text.lower() not in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp', 'ep']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio}, Live: {is_live}, Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Include if it's likely a studio album if potential_titles and (is_studio or (not is_live and not is_compilation)): album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'year': min(target_years), 'title': potential_titles[0], 'all_titles': potential_titles, 'source_file': html_file, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_data': cell_data, 'is_studio': is_studio, 'confidence': 'high' if is_studio else 'medium' } albums_from_source.append(album_info) print(f" *** ALBUM IDENTIFIED ***") print(f"\nAlbums found in {html_file}: {len(albums_from_source)}") all_albums_found.extend(albums_from_source) # Store source analysis source_analysis.append({ 'filename': html_file, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_headings), 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_source) }) print() print("=== FINAL RESULTS COMPILATION ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums_sorted = sorted(all_albums_found, key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'])) print(f"Total pre-1999 albums found: {len(all_albums_sorted)}\n") # Display by artist for target_artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums_sorted if album['artist'] == target_artist] print(f"--- {target_artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): confidence_icon = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" print(f"{i}. {confidence_icon} **{album['year']}**: {album['title']}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" Alternative titles: {album['all_titles']}") print(f" Raw data: {album['row_data']}") print() # Create comprehensive summary final_results = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'methodology': 'Wikipedia HTML parsing with table analysis', 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums_sorted), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'title': album['title'], 'alternative_titles': album['all_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'], 'confidence': album['confidence'] } for album in all_albums_sorted ], 'source_analysis': source_analysis } # Save results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print("=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Research completed: {final_results['research_completed']}") print(f"Total albums found: {final_results['total_albums_found']}") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums") if final_results['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE PRE-1999 ALBUM LIST**:") for album in final_results['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} ({album['year']}): {album['title']}") else: print("\nNo albums found in the target period.") print(f"\nDetailed results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json") print(f"\nSources analyzed:") for source in source_analysis: print(f" - {source['filename']}: {source['albums_extracted']} albums extracted") # Manual verification for known albums print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION CHECK ===\n") known_pre1999_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': ['Tidal'], # Released July 1996 'Paula Cole': ['Harbinger', 'This Fire'] # Harbinger 1994, This Fire 1996 } for artist, expected_albums in known_pre1999_albums.items(): found_titles = [album['title'].lower() for album in final_results['detailed_albums'] if album['artist'] == artist] print(f"{artist} - Expected albums: {expected_albums}") for expected in expected_albums: found = any(expected.lower() in title for title in found_titles) status = "âœ“ Found" if found else "âœ— Missing" print(f" {status}: {expected}") print()
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE PRE-1999 ALBUMS: CLEAN IMPLEMENTATION === Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999) Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole Approach: Clean parsing without variable scope issues === WORKSPACE INSPECTION === Total files in workspace: 4 HTML files available: 3 - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html: 247,584 bytes - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple.html: 322,582 bytes - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html: 188,126 bytes === ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA === --- Processing en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html --- Artist: Paula Cole Page title: Paula Cole - Wikipedia Discography sections found: 2 - H2: Discography - H3: Studio albums Total tables found: 7 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_lower' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/é¡¹ç›®/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 103, in <module> File "<string>", line 103, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_lower' is not defined
developer
2025-08-03 04:15:09
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE PRE-1999 ALBUMS: FIXED IMPLEMENTATION ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Approach: Clean parsing with proper variable scoping\n") # First, inspect workspace to understand available files print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") exit() workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") print(f"HTML files available: {len(html_files)}\n") for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f"- {html_file}: {file_size:,} bytes") if not html_files: print("No HTML files found. Need to download Wikipedia pages first.") exit() print("\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results all_albums_found = [] source_analysis = [] # Process each HTML file for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) print(f"--- Processing {html_file} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' continue print(f"Artist: {artist}") # Load and parse HTML with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_tag = soup.find('title') page_title = title_tag.get_text().strip() if title_tag else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find discography sections discography_headings = [] all_headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in all_headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() discography_keywords = ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums'] # Check if any keyword is in the heading text is_discography_heading = False for keyword in discography_keywords: if keyword in heading_text: is_discography_heading = True break if is_discography_heading: discography_headings.append({ 'text': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_headings)}") for section in discography_headings: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['text']}") # Find and analyze tables all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Total tables found: {len(all_tables)}") # Look for tables with 1990s years and album information album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() # Check for 1990s years (1990-1998) has_target_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) # Check for album-related keywords - avoid variable scope issues table_text_lower = table_text.lower() album_keywords = ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release'] keyword_count = 0 for keyword in album_keywords: if keyword in table_text_lower: keyword_count += 1 has_album_content = keyword_count >= 2 if has_target_years and has_album_content: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'table': table }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album data *** ANALYZING ***") print(f"Relevant album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from relevant tables albums_from_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['table'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get headers header_cells = table.find_all('th') headers = [th.get_text().strip() for th in header_cells] print(f" Headers: {headers}") # Process data rows rows = table.find_all('tr') data_rows = rows[1:] if len(rows) > 1 else rows # Skip header if present for row_idx, row in enumerate(data_rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns cell_data = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_data) # Look for years in target range (1990-1998) year_matches = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years = [] for year_str in year_matches: year_int = int(year_str) if 1990 <= year_int <= 1998: target_years.append(year_int) if target_years: print(f" Row {row_idx + 1}: {cell_data}") print(f" Target years found: {target_years}") # Identify album type - avoid variable scope issues row_text_lower = row_text.lower() # Check for studio album indicators studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album'] is_studio = False for indicator in studio_indicators: if indicator in row_text_lower: is_studio = True break # Check for live album indicators live_indicators = ['live', 'concert'] is_live = False for indicator in live_indicators: if indicator in row_text_lower: is_live = True break # Check for compilation indicators compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of'] is_compilation = False for indicator in compilation_indicators: if indicator in row_text_lower: is_compilation = True break # Extract potential album titles potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_data: # Skip years, short text, and obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 3 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and cell_text.lower() not in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp', 'ep']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio}, Live: {is_live}, Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Include if it's likely a studio album if potential_titles and (is_studio or (not is_live and not is_compilation)): album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'year': min(target_years), 'title': potential_titles[0], 'all_titles': potential_titles, 'source_file': html_file, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_data': cell_data, 'is_studio': is_studio, 'confidence': 'high' if is_studio else 'medium' } albums_from_source.append(album_info) print(f" *** ALBUM IDENTIFIED ***") print(f"\nAlbums found in {html_file}: {len(albums_from_source)}") all_albums_found.extend(albums_from_source) # Store source analysis source_analysis.append({ 'filename': html_file, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_headings), 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_source) }) print() print("=== FINAL RESULTS COMPILATION ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums_sorted = sorted(all_albums_found, key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'])) print(f"Total pre-1999 albums found: {len(all_albums_sorted)}\n") # Display by artist for target_artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums_sorted if album['artist'] == target_artist] print(f"--- {target_artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): confidence_icon = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" print(f"{i}. {confidence_icon} **{album['year']}**: {album['title']}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" Alternative titles: {album['all_titles']}") print(f" Raw data: {album['row_data']}") print() # Create comprehensive summary final_results = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'methodology': 'Wikipedia HTML parsing with table analysis', 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums_sorted), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'title': album['title'], 'alternative_titles': album['all_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'], 'confidence': album['confidence'] } for album in all_albums_sorted ], 'source_analysis': source_analysis } # Save results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print("=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Research completed: {final_results['research_completed']}") print(f"Total albums found: {final_results['total_albums_found']}") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums") if final_results['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE PRE-1999 ALBUM LIST**:") for album in final_results['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} ({album['year']}): {album['title']}") else: print("\nNo albums found in the target period.") print(f"\nDetailed results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json") print(f"\nSources analyzed:") for source in source_analysis: print(f" - {source['filename']}: {source['albums_extracted']} albums extracted") # Manual verification for known albums print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION CHECK ===\n") known_pre1999_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': ['Tidal'], # Released July 1996 'Paula Cole': ['Harbinger', 'This Fire'] # Harbinger 1994, This Fire 1996 } for artist, expected_albums in known_pre1999_albums.items(): found_titles = [album['title'].lower() for album in final_results['detailed_albums'] if album['artist'] == artist] print(f"{artist} - Expected albums: {expected_albums}") for expected in expected_albums: found = any(expected.lower() in title for title in found_titles) status = "âœ“ Found" if found else "âœ— Missing" print(f" {status}: {expected}") print()

tester
2025-08-03 04:15:09
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code contains a critical variable name error that prevents album extraction from Wikipedia data. The code successfully identified 3 HTML files (758KB total) with Fiona Apple and Paula Cole discography information and found discography sections, but crashes with 'NameError: name 'expected' is not defined' in the verification section at the end. However, before the crash, the code DID extract album data - it found 13 total albums but many appear to be singles/songs rather than actual albums. The output shows problematic extractions like individual song titles ('Shadowboxer', 'Sleep to Dream') and award show names ('Billboard Music Awards', '40th Grammy Awards') being identified as albums. **PLAN** alignment: 80% - Data extraction works but needs filtering refinement. The code successfully found legitimate albums like 'Tidal' (1996) for Fiona Apple and references to 'Harbinger' and 'This Fire' for Paula Cole, but the filtering logic is too permissive. Immediate fixes needed: (1) Fix the variable name error in the verification loop, (2) Improve filtering to exclude singles, music videos, and award references, (3) Focus on actual studio album releases. The core album data is being extracted successfully from Wikipedia tables.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE PRE-1999 ALBUMS: FIXED IMPLEMENTATION ===") print("Target: All albums released before 1999 (release date < January 1, 1999)") print("Artists: Fiona Apple and Paula Cole") print("Approach: Clean parsing with proper variable scoping\n") # First, inspect workspace to understand available files print("=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===\n") if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") exit() workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"Total files in workspace: {len(workspace_files)}") print(f"HTML files available: {len(html_files)}\n") for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f"- {html_file}: {file_size:,} bytes") if not html_files: print("No HTML files found. Need to download Wikipedia pages first.") exit() print("\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR ALBUM DATA ===\n") # Initialize results all_albums_found = [] source_analysis = [] # Process each HTML file for html_file in html_files: file_path = os.path.join('workspace', html_file) print(f"--- Processing {html_file} ---") # Determine artist from filename if 'fiona_apple' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Fiona Apple' elif 'paula_cole' in html_file.lower(): artist = 'Paula Cole' else: artist = 'Unknown' continue print(f"Artist: {artist}") # Load and parse HTML with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title_tag = soup.find('title') page_title = title_tag.get_text().strip() if title_tag else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find discography sections discography_headings = [] all_headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in all_headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() discography_keywords = ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums'] # Check if any keyword is in the heading text is_discography_heading = False for keyword in discography_keywords: if keyword in heading_text: is_discography_heading = True break if is_discography_heading: discography_headings.append({ 'text': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name }) print(f"Discography sections found: {len(discography_headings)}") for section in discography_headings: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['text']}") # Find and analyze tables all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Total tables found: {len(all_tables)}") # Look for tables with 1990s years and album information album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() # Check for 1990s years (1990-1998) has_target_years = bool(re.search(r'199[0-8]', table_text)) # Check for album-related keywords - avoid variable scope issues table_text_lower = table_text.lower() album_keywords = ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'release'] keyword_count = 0 for keyword in album_keywords: if keyword in table_text_lower: keyword_count += 1 has_album_content = keyword_count >= 2 if has_target_years and has_album_content: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'table': table }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains 1990s album data *** ANALYZING ***") print(f"Relevant album tables: {len(album_tables)}") # Extract album information from relevant tables albums_from_source = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['table'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Extracting from Table {table_index + 1}:") # Get headers header_cells = table.find_all('th') headers = [th.get_text().strip() for th in header_cells] print(f" Headers: {headers}") # Process data rows rows = table.find_all('tr') data_rows = rows[1:] if len(rows) > 1 else rows # Skip header if present for row_idx, row in enumerate(data_rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns cell_data = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_data) # Look for years in target range (1990-1998) year_matches = re.findall(r'199[0-8]', row_text) target_years = [] for year_str in year_matches: year_int = int(year_str) if 1990 <= year_int <= 1998: target_years.append(year_int) if target_years: print(f" Row {row_idx + 1}: {cell_data}") print(f" Target years found: {target_years}") # Identify album type - avoid variable scope issues row_text_lower = row_text.lower() # Check for studio album indicators studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album'] is_studio = False for indicator in studio_indicators: if indicator in row_text_lower: is_studio = True break # Check for live album indicators live_indicators = ['live', 'concert'] is_live = False for indicator in live_indicators: if indicator in row_text_lower: is_live = True break # Check for compilation indicators compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of'] is_compilation = False for indicator in compilation_indicators: if indicator in row_text_lower: is_compilation = True break # Extract potential album titles potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_data: # Skip years, short text, and obvious metadata if (len(cell_text) > 3 and not re.match(r'^199[0-8]$', cell_text) and cell_text.lower() not in ['album', 'studio album', 'lp', 'ep']): potential_titles.append(cell_text) print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio}, Live: {is_live}, Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Include if it's likely a studio album if potential_titles and (is_studio or (not is_live and not is_compilation)): album_info = { 'artist': artist, 'year': min(target_years), 'title': potential_titles[0], 'all_titles': potential_titles, 'source_file': html_file, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_data': cell_data, 'is_studio': is_studio, 'confidence': 'high' if is_studio else 'medium' } albums_from_source.append(album_info) print(f" *** ALBUM IDENTIFIED ***") print(f"\nAlbums found in {html_file}: {len(albums_from_source)}") all_albums_found.extend(albums_from_source) # Store source analysis source_analysis.append({ 'filename': html_file, 'artist': artist, 'page_title': page_title, 'discography_sections': len(discography_headings), 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'album_tables': len(album_tables), 'albums_extracted': len(albums_from_source) }) print() print("=== FINAL RESULTS COMPILATION ===\n") # Sort albums by artist and year all_albums_sorted = sorted(all_albums_found, key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'])) print(f"Total pre-1999 albums found: {len(all_albums_sorted)}\n") # Display by artist for target_artist in ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole']: artist_albums = [album for album in all_albums_sorted if album['artist'] == target_artist] print(f"--- {target_artist} ---") print(f"Albums found: {len(artist_albums)}\n") for i, album in enumerate(artist_albums, 1): confidence_icon = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" print(f"{i}. {confidence_icon} **{album['year']}**: {album['title']}") print(f" Source: {album['source_file']}") print(f" Alternative titles: {album['all_titles']}") print(f" Raw data: {album['row_data']}") print() # Create comprehensive summary final_results = { 'research_completed': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_criteria': 'Albums released before January 1, 1999', 'artists_researched': ['Fiona Apple', 'Paula Cole'], 'methodology': 'Wikipedia HTML parsing with table analysis', 'total_albums_found': len(all_albums_sorted), 'albums_by_artist': { 'Fiona Apple': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Fiona Apple']), 'Paula Cole': len([a for a in all_albums_sorted if a['artist'] == 'Paula Cole']) }, 'detailed_albums': [ { 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'title': album['title'], 'alternative_titles': album['all_titles'], 'source': album['source_file'], 'confidence': album['confidence'] } for album in all_albums_sorted ], 'source_analysis': source_analysis } # Save results with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print("=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Research completed: {final_results['research_completed']}") print(f"Total albums found: {final_results['total_albums_found']}") print(f"- Fiona Apple: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Fiona Apple']} albums") print(f"- Paula Cole: {final_results['albums_by_artist']['Paula Cole']} albums") if final_results['total_albums_found'] > 0: print(f"\n**COMPLETE PRE-1999 ALBUM LIST**:") for album in final_results['detailed_albums']: print(f" â€¢ {album['artist']} ({album['year']}): {album['title']}") else: print("\nNo albums found in the target period.") print(f"\nDetailed results saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json") print(f"\nSources analyzed:") for source in source_analysis: print(f" - {source['filename']}: {source['albums_extracted']} albums extracted") # Manual verification for known albums print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION CHECK ===\n") known_pre1999_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': ['Tidal'], # Released July 1996 'Paula Cole': ['Harbinger', 'This Fire'] # Harbinger 1994, This Fire 1996 } for artist, expected_albums in known_pre1999_albums.items(): found_titles = [album['title'].lower() for album in final_results['detailed_albums'] if album['artist'] == artist] print(f"{artist} - Expected albums: {expected_albums}") for expected in expected_albums: found = any(expected.lower() in title for title in found_titles) status = "âœ“ Found" if found else "âœ— Missing" print(f" {status}: {expected}") print()

'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', '', 'Pleasantville soundtrack'] 7. ðŸŸ¡ **1998**: "Please Send Me Someone to Love" Source: Love"', '1998', 'â€”', 'Pleasantville: Music from the Motion Picture'] 8. ðŸŸ¡ **1998**: "Across the Universe" Source: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Fiona_Apple_discography.html Alternative titles: ['"Across the Universe"', 'Paul Thomas Anderson'] Raw data: ['"Across the Universe"', '1998', 'Paul Thomas Anderson'] --- Paula Cole --- Albums found: 5 1. ðŸŸ¡ **1994**: "I Am So Ordinary" Source: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Alternative titles: ['"I Am So Ordinary"', 'Harbinger'] Raw data: ['1994', '"I Am So Ordinary"', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', 'â€”', '42', 'â€”', 'Harbinger'] 2. ðŸŸ¡ **1997**: "Where Have All the Cowboys Gone?" Source: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Alternative titles: ['"Where Have All the Cowboys Gone?"', 'This Fire'] Raw data: ['1997', '"Where Have All the Cowboys Gone?"', '8', '27', '4', '32', '10', '5', '32', '7', '15', 'This Fire'] 3. ðŸŸ¡ **1997**: Billboard Music Awards Source: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Alternative titles: ['Billboard Music Awards', 'Top Adult Top 40 Artist', 'Paula Cole', 'Nominated'] Raw data: ['1997', 'Billboard Music Awards', 'Top Adult Top 40 Artist', 'Paula Cole', 'Nominated'] 4. ðŸŸ¡ **1998**: "Me" Source: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Alternative titles: ['"Me"', 'â€”[A]'] Raw data: ['1998', '"Me"', 'â€”[A]', 'â€”', '17', 'â€”', 'â€”', '25', 'â€”', '20', 'â€”'] 5. ðŸŸ¡ **1998**: 40th Grammy Awards Source: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Paula_Cole.html Alternative titles: ['40th Grammy Awards', 'Record of the Year', 'Nominated'] Raw data: ['1998', '40th Grammy Awards', 'Record of the Year', 'Nominated'] === RESEARCH SUMMARY === Research completed: 2025-08-03 04:14:53 Total albums found: 13 - Fiona Apple: 8 albums - Paula Cole: 5 albums **COMPLETE PRE-1999 ALBUM LIST**: â€¢ Fiona Apple (1996): Tidal â€¢ Fiona Apple (1996): "Shadowboxer" â€¢ Fiona Apple (1996): "Shadowboxer" â€¢ Fiona Apple (1997): "Sleep to Dream" â€¢ Fiona Apple (1997): "The First Taste" â€¢ Fiona Apple (1998): "Across the Universe"[42] â€¢ Fiona Apple (1998): "Please Send Me Someone to Love" â€¢ Fiona Apple (1998): "Across the Universe" â€¢ Paula Cole (1994): "I Am So Ordinary" â€¢ Paula Cole (1997): "Where Have All the Cowboys Gone?" â€¢ Paula Cole (1997): Billboard Music Awards â€¢ Paula Cole (1998): "Me" â€¢ Paula Cole (1998): 40th Grammy Awards Detailed results saved to: workspace_f46b4380-207e-4434-820b-f32ce04ae2a4/fiona_apple_paula_cole_pre1999_final.json Sources analyzed: -
