Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS RESEARCH (FIXED) ===\n") print("Target Albums:") print("1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996)") print("2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994)") print("3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997)") print("\nObjective: Find Christgau's Consumer Guide reviews and letter grades\n") # Define target albums with search variations target_albums = [ { 'title': 'Tidal', 'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'year': 1996, 'search_terms': ['fiona apple tidal', 'fiona apple 1996', 'tidal fiona'] }, { 'title': 'Harbinger', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1994, 'search_terms': ['paula cole harbinger', 'paula cole 1994', 'harbinger paula'] }, { 'title': 'This Fire', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1997, 'search_terms': ['paula cole this fire', 'paula cole 1997', 'this fire paula'] } ] # Initialize variables that caused the previous error album_reviews_found = [] successful_sources = [] failed_sources = [] relevant_sources = [] headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Updated Christgau sources with working URLs christgau_sources = [ "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php", # Artist search page "https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php", # 1990s grades "https://www.robertchristgau.com", # Main site "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php", # Chapter/review search "https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/music/index.php", # Music section ] print("=== STEP 1: ACCESSING CHRISTGAU'S WEBSITE ===\n") for url in christgau_sources: print(f"Trying: {url}") try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {url}") # Save the content for analysis filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('=', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # Quick content analysis soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' # Look for our target artists/albums content_text = soup.get_text().lower() artist_mentions = { 'fiona_apple': 'fiona apple' in content_text, 'paula_cole': 'paula cole' in content_text, 'tidal': 'tidal' in content_text, 'harbinger': 'harbinger' in content_text, 'this_fire': 'this fire' in content_text or 'thisfire' in content_text } # Look for grade indicators grade_indicators = ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-'] has_grades = any(grade in response.text for grade in grade_indicators) successful_sources.append({ 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'filename': filepath, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'artist_mentions': artist_mentions, 'has_grades': has_grades, 'relevant_content': any(artist_mentions.values()) }) print(f" Title: {title_text}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text)} characters") print(f" Artist mentions: {[k for k, v in artist_mentions.items() if v]}") print(f" Contains grades: {has_grades}") if any(artist_mentions.values()): print(f" *** CONTAINS TARGET ARTIST CONTENT ***") else: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {url} - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {url}: {str(e)}") time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print() print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_sources)} sources") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_sources)} sources") # Analyze successful sources for relevant content relevant_sources = [s for s in successful_sources if s['relevant_content']] print(f"Sources with target artist content: {len(relevant_sources)}") # Also check all successful sources manually for any missed content print("\n=== MANUAL CONTENT INSPECTION ===\n") for source in successful_sources: print(f"Inspecting: {source['url']}") print(f"File: {source['filename']}") # Read and inspect content more thoroughly with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Print first 500 characters to understand the page structure text_content = soup.get_text() print(f"First 500 characters of content:") print(text_content[:500] + "..." if len(text_content) > 500 else text_content) print() # Look for forms or search functionality forms = soup.find_all('form') if forms: print(f"Found {len(forms)} forms on this page:") for i, form in enumerate(forms): action = form.get('action', 'No action') method = form.get('method', 'No method') inputs = form.find_all('input') print(f" Form {i+1}: Action='{action}', Method='{method}', Inputs={len(inputs)}") # Check if this might be a search form for inp in inputs: inp_name = inp.get('name', '') inp_type = inp.get('type', '') if 'search' in inp_name.lower() or 'artist' in inp_name.lower() or 'album' in inp_name.lower(): print(f" Potential search input: name='{inp_name}', type='{inp_type}'") # Look for links that might lead to artist pages or search results links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Check for artist-related links if any(artist in link_text for artist in ['fiona apple', 'paula cole']) or \ any(artist in href.lower() for artist in ['fiona', 'paula']): relevant_links.append({ 'href': href, 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'full_url': href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.robertchristgau.com{href}" if href.startswith('/') else f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/{href}" }) if relevant_links: print(f"Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:") for link in relevant_links[:5]: # Show first 5 print(f" - {link['text']}: {link['full_url']}") print("-" * 60) if relevant_sources: print("\n=== ANALYZING RELEVANT SOURCES ===\n") for source in relevant_sources: print(f"Analyzing: {source['url']}") print(f"File: {source['filename']}") with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Search for each target album for album in target_albums: print(f"\n Searching for: {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") # Look for various patterns that might indicate a review album_found = False review_context = [] # Search for artist name and album title combinations for search_term in album['search_terms']: if search_term.lower() in soup.get_text().lower(): print(f" Found search term: '{search_term}'") album_found = True # Try to find the specific context/paragraph containing the review text_content = soup.get_text() lines = text_content.split('\n') for i, line in enumerate(lines): if search_term.lower() in line.lower(): # Get context around the match (5 lines before and after) start_idx = max(0, i-5) end_idx = min(len(lines), i+6) context_lines = lines[start_idx:end_idx] context = '\n'.join(context_lines).strip() if context and len(context) > 20: # Avoid empty or very short contexts review_context.append({ 'search_term': search_term, 'context': context, 'line_number': i }) print(f" Context found at line {i}") print(f" Context preview: {context[:200]}...") if album_found: # Look for letter grades in the contexts grades_found = [] for context_info in review_context: context_text = context_info['context'] # Search for Christgau's letter grade patterns grade_patterns = [ r'\b([A-E][+-]?)\b', # Standard letter grades with optional +/- r'\b(A\+|A-|B\+|B-|C\+|C-|D\+|D-|E\+|E-)\b', # Explicit +/- grades ] for pattern in grade_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, context_text) for match in matches: # Filter out common false positives if match.upper() in ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-']: grades_found.append({ 'grade': match, 'context': context_text[:300] + '...' if len(context_text) > 300 else context_text }) album_review_info = { 'album': album['title'], 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'source_url': source['url'], 'source_file': source['filename'], 'found_in_source': True, 'review_contexts': review_context, 'grades_found': grades_found, 'has_grade': len(grades_found) > 0 } album_reviews_found.append(album_review_info) print(f" Review status: FOUND") print(f" Contexts found: {len(review_context)}") print(f" Grades found: {len(grades_found)}") if grades_found: for grade_info in grades_found: print(f" Grade: {grade_info['grade']}") print(f" Context: {grade_info['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f" Review status: NOT FOUND in this source") print(f"\n Source analysis complete: {source['filename']}") print("-" * 60) else: print("\n=== NO RELEVANT SOURCES FOUND ===\n") print("The initial search did not find target artists in the accessed pages.") print("This might indicate:") print("1. The artists/albums are not prominently featured on these main pages") print("2. We need to use search functionality or direct URL construction") print("3. The content might be in a database that requires specific queries") print("\nNext step: Try to use search forms or construct direct URLs") # Compile final results print(f"\n=== COMPILATION OF RESULTS ===\n") final_results = { 'research_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_albums': target_albums, 'sources_accessed': len(successful_sources), 'relevant_sources': len(relevant_sources), 'album_reviews': album_reviews_found } # Create summary for each album print("CHRISTGAU REVIEW FINDINGS:\n") for album in target_albums: album_title = f"{album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})" print(f"ðŸ“€ {album_title}") # Find reviews for this album album_reviews = [r for r in album_reviews_found if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: print(f" âœ“ Found in: {review['source_url']}") print(f" Contexts: {len(review['review_contexts'])}") if review['has_grade']: print(f" ðŸŽ¯ GRADES FOUND:") for grade in review['grades_found']: print(f" Grade: {grade['grade']}") print(f" Context: {grade['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f" âŒ No letter grades found") else: print(f" âŒ No reviews found in accessed sources") print() # Save detailed results with open('workspace/christgau_reviews_analysis.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"Detailed results saved to: workspace/christgau_reviews_analysis.json") # Create summary report summary_report = [] summary_report.append("ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS - RESEARCH SUMMARY") summary_report.append("=" * 60) summary_report.append(f"Research Date: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}") summary_report.append(f"Sources Accessed: {len(successful_sources)}") summary_report.append(f"Relevant Sources: {len(relevant_sources)}") summary_report.append("") summary_report.append("TARGET ALBUMS:") for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in album_reviews_found if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] summary_report.append(f"\nâ€¢ {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: summary_report.append(f" Status: FOUND") summary_report.append(f" Source: {review['source_url']}") if review['has_grade']: grades_list = [g['grade'] for g in review['grades_found']] summary_report.append(f" Christgau Grade(s): {', '.join(grades_list)}") else: summary_report.append(f" Christgau Grade: NO GRADE FOUND") else: summary_report.append(f" Status: NOT FOUND") summary_report.append(f" Christgau Grade: NO REVIEW FOUND") summary_report.append("") summary_report.append("=" * 60) summary_report.append("Research complete. Check individual source files for detailed content.") with open('workspace/christgau_reviews_summary.txt', 'w') as f: f.write('\n'.join(summary_report)) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Summary report saved to: workspace/christgau_reviews_summary.txt") print(f"Next steps: Use search functionality or try direct URL construction for specific artist pages") print(f"Focus: Access Christgau's database search to find specific album reviews and grades")
Execution Output
Code Output: === ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS RESEARCH (FIXED) === Target Albums: 1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996) 2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994) 3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997) Objective: Find Christgau's Consumer Guide reviews and letter grades === STEP 1: ACCESSING CHRISTGAU'S WEBSITE === Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php: name 'response' is not defined Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php: name 'response' is not defined Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com: name 'response' is not defined Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_71345b0a-9c7d-4b50-b2bf-937ec5879845 --- Attempting to scrape Google Finance for Apple data --- Fetching: https://www.google.com/finance/quote/AAPL:NASDAQ Error scraping Google Finance: name 'headers' is not defined Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/music/index.php âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/music/index.php: name 'response' is not defined --- Attempting to access MarketWatch for Apple historical data --- Fetching: https://www.marketwatch.com/investing/stock/aapl/charts Error scraping MarketWatch: name 'headers' is not defined ================================================================================ SCRAPING RESULTS SUMMARY ================================================================================ âœ“ stock_splits: Retrieved 5 historical stock splits âœ— yahoo_finance: Failed - 1980s: Early growth period - 1990s: Struggles and recovery - 2000s: iPod era and resurgence - 2007+: iPhone era Remember: We need NON-split-adjusted prices to find when it first hit $50 Current split-adjusted prices will be much lower than historical actual prices

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code has a critical variable scoping issue and appears to be running completely different code than intended. The script shows it's accessing Christgau's website successfully (status 200 responses) but then encounters 'name 'response' is not defined' errors immediately after successful access, followed by completely unrelated Apple stock scraping code executing. This suggests a severe code execution environment issue where multiple scripts are interfering with each other. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no Christgau review data was extracted due to the execution errors. The output shows workspace files being created but the analysis never completes. Recommended fix: (1) Initialize all variables (album_reviews_found, successful_sources, etc.) at the script beginning, (2) Fix the variable scope issue where 'response' becomes undefined after successful requests, (3) Investigate why unrelated stock scraping code is executing, and (4) Ensure the script runs in isolation without interference from other processes.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS RESEARCH (FIXED) ===\n") print("Target Albums:") print("1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996)") print("2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994)") print("3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997)") print("\nObjective: Find Christgau's Consumer Guide reviews and letter grades\n") # Define target albums with search variations target_albums = [ { 'title': 'Tidal', 'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'year': 1996, 'search_terms': ['fiona apple tidal', 'fiona apple 1996', 'tidal fiona'] }, { 'title': 'Harbinger', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1994, 'search_terms': ['paula cole harbinger', 'paula cole 1994', 'harbinger paula'] }, { 'title': 'This Fire', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1997, 'search_terms': ['paula cole this fire', 'paula cole 1997', 'this fire paula'] } ] # Initialize variables that caused the previous error album_reviews_found = [] successful_sources = [] failed_sources = [] relevant_sources = [] headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Updated Christgau sources with working URLs christgau_sources = [ "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php", # Artist search page "https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php", # 1990s grades "https://www.robertchristgau.com", # Main site "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php", # Chapter/review search "https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/music/index.php", # Music section ] print("=== STEP 1: ACCESSING CHRISTGAU'S WEBSITE ===\n") for url in christgau_sources: print(f"Trying: {url}") try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {url}") # Save the content for analysis filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_').replace('?', '_').replace('=', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # Quick content analysis soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' # Look for our target artists/albums content_text = soup.get_text().lower() artist_mentions = { 'fiona_apple': 'fiona apple' in content_text, 'paula_cole': 'paula cole' in content_text, 'tidal': 'tidal' in content_text, 'harbinger': 'harbinger' in content_text, 'this_fire': 'this fire' in content_text or 'thisfire' in content_text } # Look for grade indicators grade_indicators = ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-'] has_grades = any(grade in response.text for grade in grade_indicators) successful_sources.append({ 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'filename': filepath, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'artist_mentions': artist_mentions, 'has_grades': has_grades, 'relevant_content': any(artist_mentions.values()) }) print(f" Title: {title_text}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text)} characters") print(f" Artist mentions: {[k for k, v in artist_mentions.items() if v]}") print(f" Contains grades: {has_grades}") if any(artist_mentions.values()): print(f" *** CONTAINS TARGET ARTIST CONTENT ***") else: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {url} - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {url}: {str(e)}") time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print() print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_sources)} sources") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_sources)} sources") # Analyze successful sources for relevant content relevant_sources = [s for s in successful_sources if s['relevant_content']] print(f"Sources with target artist content: {len(relevant_sources)}") # Also check all successful sources manually for any missed content print("\n=== MANUAL CONTENT INSPECTION ===\n") for source in successful_sources: print(f"Inspecting: {source['url']}") print(f"File: {source['filename']}") # Read and inspect content more thoroughly with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Print first 500 characters to understand the page structure text_content = soup.get_text() print(f"First 500 characters of content:") print(text_content[:500] + "..." if len(text_content) > 500 else text_content) print() # Look for forms or search functionality forms = soup.find_all('form') if forms: print(f"Found {len(forms)} forms on this page:") for i, form in enumerate(forms): action = form.get('action', 'No action') method = form.get('method', 'No method') inputs = form.find_all('input') print(f" Form {i+1}: Action='{action}', Method='{method}', Inputs={len(inputs)}") # Check if this might be a search form for inp in inputs: inp_name = inp.get('name', '') inp_type = inp.get('type', '') if 'search' in inp_name.lower() or 'artist' in inp_name.lower() or 'album' in inp_name.lower(): print(f" Potential search input: name='{inp_name}', type='{inp_type}'") # Look for links that might lead to artist pages or search results links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Check for artist-related links if any(artist in link_text for artist in ['fiona apple', 'paula cole']) or \ any(artist in href.lower() for artist in ['fiona', 'paula']): relevant_links.append({ 'href': href, 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'full_url': href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.robertchristgau.com{href}" if href.startswith('/') else f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/{href}" }) if relevant_links: print(f"Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:") for link in relevant_links[:5]: # Show first 5 print(f" - {link['text']}: {link['full_url']}") print("-" * 60) if relevant_sources: print("\n=== ANALYZING RELEVANT SOURCES ===\n") for source in relevant_sources: print(f"Analyzing: {source['url']}") print(f"File: {source['filename']}") with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Search for each target album for album in target_albums: print(f"\n Searching for: {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") # Look for various patterns that might indicate a review album_found = False review_context = [] # Search for artist name and album title combinations for search_term in album['search_terms']: if search_term.lower() in soup.get_text().lower(): print(f" Found search term: '{search_term}'") album_found = True # Try to find the specific context/paragraph containing the review text_content = soup.get_text() lines = text_content.split('\n') for i, line in enumerate(lines): if search_term.lower() in line.lower(): # Get context around the match (5 lines before and after) start_idx = max(0, i-5) end_idx = min(len(lines), i+6) context_lines = lines[start_idx:end_idx] context = '\n'.join(context_lines).strip() if context and len(context) > 20: # Avoid empty or very short contexts review_context.append({ 'search_term': search_term, 'context': context, 'line_number': i }) print(f" Context found at line {i}") print(f" Context preview: {context[:200]}...") if album_found: # Look for letter grades in the contexts grades_found = [] for context_info in review_context: context_text = context_info['context'] # Search for Christgau's letter grade patterns grade_patterns = [ r'\b([A-E][+-]?)\b', # Standard letter grades with optional +/- r'\b(A\+|A-|B\+|B-|C\+|C-|D\+|D-|E\+|E-)\b', # Explicit +/- grades ] for pattern in grade_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, context_text) for match in matches: # Filter out common false positives if match.upper() in ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-']: grades_found.append({ 'grade': match, 'context': context_text[:300] + '...' if len(context_text) > 300 else context_text }) album_review_info = { 'album': album['title'], 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'source_url': source['url'], 'source_file': source['filename'], 'found_in_source': True, 'review_contexts': review_context, 'grades_found': grades_found, 'has_grade': len(grades_found) > 0 } album_reviews_found.append(album_review_info) print(f" Review status: FOUND") print(f" Contexts found: {len(review_context)}") print(f" Grades found: {len(grades_found)}") if grades_found: for grade_info in grades_found: print(f" Grade: {grade_info['grade']}") print(f" Context: {grade_info['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f" Review status: NOT FOUND in this source") print(f"\n Source analysis complete: {source['filename']}") print("-" * 60) else: print("\n=== NO RELEVANT SOURCES FOUND ===\n") print("The initial search did not find target artists in the accessed pages.") print("This might indicate:") print("1. The artists/albums are not prominently featured on these main pages") print("2. We need to use search functionality or direct URL construction") print("3. The content might be in a database that requires specific queries") print("\nNext step: Try to use search forms or construct direct URLs") # Compile final results print(f"\n=== COMPILATION OF RESULTS ===\n") final_results = { 'research_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_albums': target_albums, 'sources_accessed': len(successful_sources), 'relevant_sources': len(relevant_sources), 'album_reviews': album_reviews_found } # Create summary for each album print("CHRISTGAU REVIEW FINDINGS:\n") for album in target_albums: album_title = f"{album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})" print(f"ðŸ“€ {album_title}") # Find reviews for this album album_reviews = [r for r in album_reviews_found if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: print(f" âœ“ Found in: {review['source_url']}") print(f" Contexts: {len(review['review_contexts'])}") if review['has_grade']: print(f" ðŸŽ¯ GRADES FOUND:") for grade in review['grades_found']: print(f" Grade: {grade['grade']}") print(f" Context: {grade['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f" âŒ No letter grades found") else: print(f" âŒ No reviews found in accessed sources") print() # Save detailed results with open('workspace/christgau_reviews_analysis.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"Detailed results saved to: workspace/christgau_reviews_analysis.json") # Create summary report summary_report = [] summary_report.append("ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS - RESEARCH SUMMARY") summary_report.append("=" * 60) summary_report.append(f"Research Date: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}") summary_report.append(f"Sources Accessed: {len(successful_sources)}") summary_report.append(f"Relevant Sources: {len(relevant_sources)}") summary_report.append("") summary_report.append("TARGET ALBUMS:") for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in album_reviews_found if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] summary_report.append(f"\nâ€¢ {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: summary_report.append(f" Status: FOUND") summary_report.append(f" Source: {review['source_url']}") if review['has_grade']: grades_list = [g['grade'] for g in review['grades_found']] summary_report.append(f" Christgau Grade(s): {', '.join(grades_list)}") else: summary_report.append(f" Christgau Grade: NO GRADE FOUND") else: summary_report.append(f" Status: NOT FOUND") summary_report.append(f" Christgau Grade: NO REVIEW FOUND") summary_report.append("") summary_report.append("=" * 60) summary_report.append("Research complete. Check individual source files for detailed content.") with open('workspace/christgau_reviews_summary.txt', 'w') as f: f.write('\n'.join(summary_report)) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Summary report saved to: workspace/christgau_reviews_summary.txt") print(f"Next steps: Use search functionality or try direct URL construction for specific artist pages") print(f"Focus: Access Christgau's database search to find specific album reviews and grades")

'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997) Objective: Find Christgau's Consumer Guide reviews and letter grades === STEP 1: ACCESSING CHRISTGAU'S WEBSITE === Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php: name 'response' is not defined Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php: name 'response' is not defined Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com: name 'response' is not defined Trying: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_71345b0a-9c7d-4b50-b2bf-937ec5879845 --- Attempting to scrape Google Finance for Apple data --- Fetching: https://www.google.com/finance/quote/AAPL:NASDAQ Error scraping Google Finance: name 'headers' is not defined Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/music/index.php âœ— Error accessing https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/music/index.php: name 'response' is not defined --- Attempting to access MarketWatch for Apple historical data --- Fetching: https://www.marketwatch.com/investing/stock/aapl/charts Error scraping MarketWatch: name 'headers' is not defined ================================================================================ SCRAPING RESULTS SUMMARY ================================================================================ âœ“ stock_splits: Retrieved 5 historical stock splits âœ— yahoo_finance: Failed - 1980s: Early growth period - 1990s: Struggles and recovery - 2000s: iPod era and resurgence - 2007+: iPhone era Remember: We need NON-split-adjusted prices to find when it first hit $50 Current split-adjusted prices will be much lower than historical actual prices

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== ROBERT CHRISTGAU REVIEWS SEARCH ===\n") print("Target Albums:") print("1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996)") print("2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994)") print("3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997)") print("\nSearching for Consumer Guide reviews and letter grades...\n") # Define search targets target_albums = [ {'title': 'Tidal', 'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'year': 1996}, {'title': 'Harbinger', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1994}, {'title': 'This Fire', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1997} ] # Initialize results storage research_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'albums_searched': target_albums, 'sources_accessed': [], 'reviews_found': [] } # Request headers request_headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' } print("=== STEP 1: ACCESSING CHRISTGAU'S MAIN WEBSITE ===\n") # Start with the main Christgau website main_url = "https://www.robertchristgau.com" try: print(f"Accessing: {main_url}") main_response = requests.get(main_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=15) print(f"Status: {main_response.status_code}") if main_response.status_code == 200: print("âœ“ Successfully accessed main site") # Save main page main_file = 'workspace/christgau_main_page.html' with open(main_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(main_response.text) print(f"Main page saved to: {main_file}") print(f"Content length: {len(main_response.text)} characters") # Parse main page for navigation and search options main_soup = BeautifulSoup(main_response.text, 'html.parser') page_title = main_soup.find('title') print(f"Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'No title'}") # Look for search forms or artist database links forms = main_soup.find_all('form') print(f"\nForms found: {len(forms)}") for i, form in enumerate(forms): action = form.get('action', 'No action') method = form.get('method', 'GET') inputs = form.find_all('input') print(f" Form {i+1}: action='{action}', method='{method}', inputs={len(inputs)}") # Check for search-related inputs for inp in inputs: name = inp.get('name', '') inp_type = inp.get('type', '') if name and ('search' in name.lower() or 'artist' in name.lower()): print(f" Search input found: name='{name}', type='{inp_type}'") # Look for relevant navigation links nav_links = [] all_links = main_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in all_links: href = link.get('href') link_text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Look for database, search, or artist-related links if any(keyword in link_text for keyword in ['database', 'search', 'artist', 'consumer guide', 'reviews']): full_url = href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.robertchristgau.com{href}" nav_links.append({ 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'url': full_url }) print(f"\nRelevant navigation links found: {len(nav_links)}") for link in nav_links[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {link['text']}: {link['url']}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': main_url, 'status': 'success', 'file_saved': main_file, 'forms_found': len(forms), 'nav_links_found': len(nav_links) }) else: print(f"âœ— Failed to access main site: {main_response.status_code}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': main_url, 'status': 'failed', 'error': f'HTTP {main_response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f"âœ— Error accessing main site: {str(e)}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': main_url, 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) time.sleep(2) print("\n=== STEP 2: TRYING SPECIFIC CHRISTGAU DATABASE URLS ===\n") # Try known database URLs database_urls = [ "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php", "https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php", "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php" ] for db_url in database_urls: try: print(f"Accessing: {db_url}") db_response = requests.get(db_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=15) print(f"Status: {db_response.status_code}") if db_response.status_code == 200: print("âœ“ Successfully accessed database page") # Save database page filename = db_url.split('/')[-1].replace('.php', '') + '.html' db_file = f'workspace/christgau_{filename}' with open(db_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(db_response.text) print(f"Database page saved to: {db_file}") print(f"Content length: {len(db_response.text)} characters") # Quick content analysis db_soup = BeautifulSoup(db_response.text, 'html.parser') db_text = db_soup.get_text().lower() # Check for our target artists artist_found = { 'fiona_apple': 'fiona apple' in db_text, 'paula_cole': 'paula cole' in db_text } print(f"Artist mentions: {[k for k, v in artist_found.items() if v]}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': db_url, 'status': 'success', 'file_saved': db_file, 'artist_mentions': artist_found }) else: print(f"âœ— Failed to access: {db_response.status_code}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': db_url, 'status': 'failed', 'error': f'HTTP {db_response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f"âœ— Error accessing {db_url}: {str(e)}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': db_url, 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) time.sleep(2) print("\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING DOWNLOADED CONTENT ===\n") # Analyze all successfully downloaded files successful_files = [s for s in research_results['sources_accessed'] if s['status'] == 'success'] print(f"Successfully downloaded files: {len(successful_files)}") for file_info in successful_files: print(f"\nAnalyzing: {file_info['file_saved']}") if os.path.exists(file_info['file_saved']): with open(file_info['file_saved'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, 'html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() print(f"File size: {len(content)} characters") # Search for each target album for album in target_albums: print(f"\n Searching for: {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") # Create search patterns search_patterns = [ f"{album['artist'].lower()} {album['title'].lower()}", f"{album['title'].lower()} {album['artist'].lower()}", album['artist'].lower(), album['title'].lower() ] matches_found = [] for pattern in search_patterns: if pattern in text_content.lower(): print(f" âœ“ Found pattern: '{pattern}'") # Find context around the match text_lower = text_content.lower() match_pos = text_lower.find(pattern) if match_pos != -1: # Extract context (200 chars before and after) start = max(0, match_pos - 200) end = min(len(text_content), match_pos + len(pattern) + 200) context = text_content[start:end].strip() # Look for letter grades in context grade_pattern = r'\b([A-E][+-]?)\b' grades = re.findall(grade_pattern, context) # Filter for valid Christgau grades valid_grades = [] for grade in grades: if grade.upper() in ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-']: valid_grades.append(grade) match_info = { 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context, 'grades_found': valid_grades, 'position': match_pos } matches_found.append(match_info) print(f" Context: {context[:100]}...") if valid_grades: print(f" Grades found: {valid_grades}") if matches_found: # Compile review information review_info = { 'album': album['title'], 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'source_file': file_info['file_saved'], 'source_url': file_info['url'], 'matches': matches_found, 'has_review': True, 'grades_found': list(set([g for match in matches_found for g in match['grades_found']])) } research_results['reviews_found'].append(review_info) print(f" *** REVIEW FOUND ***") print(f" Grades: {review_info['grades_found'] if review_info['grades_found'] else 'None'}") else: print(f" No matches found") print("\n=== FINAL RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Sources accessed: {len(research_results['sources_accessed'])}") print(f"Reviews found: {len(research_results['reviews_found'])}") print("\n--- ALBUM REVIEW STATUS ---\n") for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in research_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] print(f"ðŸ“€ {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: print(f" âœ“ Review found in: {review['source_url']}") if review['grades_found']: print(f" ðŸŽ¯ Christgau Grade(s): {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") else: print(f" ðŸ“ Review found but no clear grade identified") else: print(f" âŒ No review found in accessed sources") print() # Save complete results results_file = 'workspace/christgau_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_results, f, indent=2) print(f"Complete results saved to: {results_file}") # Create summary report summary_lines = [ "ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS - SEARCH RESULTS", "=" * 50, f"Search completed: {research_results['search_timestamp']}", f"Sources accessed: {len(research_results['sources_accessed'])}", f"Reviews found: {len(research_results['reviews_found'])}", "", "RESULTS BY ALBUM:", "-" * 20 ] for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in research_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] summary_lines.append(f"\n{album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: summary_lines.append(f" Status: REVIEW FOUND") summary_lines.append(f" Source: {review['source_url']}") if review['grades_found']: summary_lines.append(f" Grade(s): {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") else: summary_lines.append(f" Grade: NO CLEAR GRADE FOUND") else: summary_lines.append(f" Status: NO REVIEW FOUND") summary_lines.append(f" Grade: NOT REVIEWED") summary_file = 'workspace/christgau_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write('\n'.join(summary_lines)) print(f"Summary report saved to: {summary_file}") print("\n=== SEARCH COMPLETE ===")
Execution Output

2025-08-03 04:25:20
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Partial success - Code executed without major errors and successfully accessed Christgau's website (status 200 responses) and downloaded HTML content to workspace files. However, there was a minor variable scoping error ('link_text' not defined) that prevented complete navigation link analysis. The script successfully accessed 4 Christgau sources, saved 3 database pages, and performed content analysis but found no reviews for any of the target albums in the accessed sources. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - successfully accessed Christgau's official website and database pages, but failed to locate the specific album reviews and letter grades. The comprehensive search results and summary files were properly saved to workspace. Next step: Fix the 'link_text' variable error and explore using the search forms found on the site (get_artist.php form with search functionality) to directly query for 'Fiona Apple' and 'Paula Cole' rather than relying on static page content analysis.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== ROBERT CHRISTGAU REVIEWS SEARCH ===\n") print("Target Albums:") print("1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996)") print("2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994)") print("3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997)") print("\nSearching for Consumer Guide reviews and letter grades...\n") # Define search targets target_albums = [ {'title': 'Tidal', 'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'year': 1996}, {'title': 'Harbinger', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1994}, {'title': 'This Fire', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1997} ] # Initialize results storage research_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'albums_searched': target_albums, 'sources_accessed': [], 'reviews_found': [] } # Request headers request_headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' } print("=== STEP 1: ACCESSING CHRISTGAU'S MAIN WEBSITE ===\n") # Start with the main Christgau website main_url = "https://www.robertchristgau.com" try: print(f"Accessing: {main_url}") main_response = requests.get(main_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=15) print(f"Status: {main_response.status_code}") if main_response.status_code == 200: print("âœ“ Successfully accessed main site") # Save main page main_file = 'workspace/christgau_main_page.html' with open(main_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(main_response.text) print(f"Main page saved to: {main_file}") print(f"Content length: {len(main_response.text)} characters") # Parse main page for navigation and search options main_soup = BeautifulSoup(main_response.text, 'html.parser') page_title = main_soup.find('title') print(f"Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'No title'}") # Look for search forms or artist database links forms = main_soup.find_all('form') print(f"\nForms found: {len(forms)}") for i, form in enumerate(forms): action = form.get('action', 'No action') method = form.get('method', 'GET') inputs = form.find_all('input') print(f" Form {i+1}: action='{action}', method='{method}', inputs={len(inputs)}") # Check for search-related inputs for inp in inputs: name = inp.get('name', '') inp_type = inp.get('type', '') if name and ('search' in name.lower() or 'artist' in name.lower()): print(f" Search input found: name='{name}', type='{inp_type}'") # Look for relevant navigation links nav_links = [] all_links = main_soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link in all_links: href = link.get('href') link_text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Look for database, search, or artist-related links if any(keyword in link_text for keyword in ['database', 'search', 'artist', 'consumer guide', 'reviews']): full_url = href if href.startswith('http') else f"https://www.robertchristgau.com{href}" nav_links.append({ 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'url': full_url }) print(f"\nRelevant navigation links found: {len(nav_links)}") for link in nav_links[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {link['text']}: {link['url']}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': main_url, 'status': 'success', 'file_saved': main_file, 'forms_found': len(forms), 'nav_links_found': len(nav_links) }) else: print(f"âœ— Failed to access main site: {main_response.status_code}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': main_url, 'status': 'failed', 'error': f'HTTP {main_response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f"âœ— Error accessing main site: {str(e)}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': main_url, 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) time.sleep(2) print("\n=== STEP 2: TRYING SPECIFIC CHRISTGAU DATABASE URLS ===\n") # Try known database URLs database_urls = [ "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php", "https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bk-cg90/grades-90s.php", "https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php" ] for db_url in database_urls: try: print(f"Accessing: {db_url}") db_response = requests.get(db_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=15) print(f"Status: {db_response.status_code}") if db_response.status_code == 200: print("âœ“ Successfully accessed database page") # Save database page filename = db_url.split('/')[-1].replace('.php', '') + '.html' db_file = f'workspace/christgau_{filename}' with open(db_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(db_response.text) print(f"Database page saved to: {db_file}") print(f"Content length: {len(db_response.text)} characters") # Quick content analysis db_soup = BeautifulSoup(db_response.text, 'html.parser') db_text = db_soup.get_text().lower() # Check for our target artists artist_found = { 'fiona_apple': 'fiona apple' in db_text, 'paula_cole': 'paula cole' in db_text } print(f"Artist mentions: {[k for k, v in artist_found.items() if v]}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': db_url, 'status': 'success', 'file_saved': db_file, 'artist_mentions': artist_found }) else: print(f"âœ— Failed to access: {db_response.status_code}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': db_url, 'status': 'failed', 'error': f'HTTP {db_response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f"âœ— Error accessing {db_url}: {str(e)}") research_results['sources_accessed'].append({ 'url': db_url, 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) time.sleep(2) print("\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING DOWNLOADED CONTENT ===\n") # Analyze all successfully downloaded files successful_files = [s for s in research_results['sources_accessed'] if s['status'] == 'success'] print(f"Successfully downloaded files: {len(successful_files)}") for file_info in successful_files: print(f"\nAnalyzing: {file_info['file_saved']}") if os.path.exists(file_info['file_saved']): with open(file_info['file_saved'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, 'html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() print(f"File size: {len(content)} characters") # Search for each target album for album in target_albums: print(f"\n Searching for: {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") # Create search patterns search_patterns = [ f"{album['artist'].lower()} {album['title'].lower()}", f"{album['title'].lower()} {album['artist'].lower()}", album['artist'].lower(), album['title'].lower() ] matches_found = [] for pattern in search_patterns: if pattern in text_content.lower(): print(f" âœ“ Found pattern: '{pattern}'") # Find context around the match text_lower = text_content.lower() match_pos = text_lower.find(pattern) if match_pos != -1: # Extract context (200 chars before and after) start = max(0, match_pos - 200) end = min(len(text_content), match_pos + len(pattern) + 200) context = text_content[start:end].strip() # Look for letter grades in context grade_pattern = r'\b([A-E][+-]?)\b' grades = re.findall(grade_pattern, context) # Filter for valid Christgau grades valid_grades = [] for grade in grades: if grade.upper() in ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-']: valid_grades.append(grade) match_info = { 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context, 'grades_found': valid_grades, 'position': match_pos } matches_found.append(match_info) print(f" Context: {context[:100]}...") if valid_grades: print(f" Grades found: {valid_grades}") if matches_found: # Compile review information review_info = { 'album': album['title'], 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'source_file': file_info['file_saved'], 'source_url': file_info['url'], 'matches': matches_found, 'has_review': True, 'grades_found': list(set([g for match in matches_found for g in match['grades_found']])) } research_results['reviews_found'].append(review_info) print(f" *** REVIEW FOUND ***") print(f" Grades: {review_info['grades_found'] if review_info['grades_found'] else 'None'}") else: print(f" No matches found") print("\n=== FINAL RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Sources accessed: {len(research_results['sources_accessed'])}") print(f"Reviews found: {len(research_results['reviews_found'])}") print("\n--- ALBUM REVIEW STATUS ---\n") for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in research_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] print(f"ðŸ“€ {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: print(f" âœ“ Review found in: {review['source_url']}") if review['grades_found']: print(f" ðŸŽ¯ Christgau Grade(s): {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") else: print(f" ðŸ“ Review found but no clear grade identified") else: print(f" âŒ No review found in accessed sources") print() # Save complete results results_file = 'workspace/christgau_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_results, f, indent=2) print(f"Complete results saved to: {results_file}") # Create summary report summary_lines = [ "ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS - SEARCH RESULTS", "=" * 50, f"Search completed: {research_results['search_timestamp']}", f"Sources accessed: {len(research_results['sources_accessed'])}", f"Reviews found: {len(research_results['reviews_found'])}", "", "RESULTS BY ALBUM:", "-" * 20 ] for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in research_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] summary_lines.append(f"\n{album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: summary_lines.append(f" Status: REVIEW FOUND") summary_lines.append(f" Source: {review['source_url']}") if review['grades_found']: summary_lines.append(f" Grade(s): {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") else: summary_lines.append(f" Grade: NO CLEAR GRADE FOUND") else: summary_lines.append(f" Status: NO REVIEW FOUND") summary_lines.append(f" Grade: NOT REVIEWED") summary_file = 'workspace/christgau_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write('\n'.join(summary_lines)) print(f"Summary report saved to: {summary_file}") print("\n=== SEARCH COMPLETE ===")
Execution Output

review found in accessed sources ðŸ“€ This Fire by Paula Cole (1997) âŒ No review found in accessed sources Complete results saved to: Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re from urllib.parse import urlencode, quote_plus # Create workspace directory if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== CHRISTGAU TARGETED ARTIST SEARCH ===\n") print("Strategy: Use search forms to directly query for artists") print("Target Artists: Fiona Apple, Paula Cole") print("Target Albums:") print("1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996)") print("2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994)") print("3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997)\n") # Define search targets target_albums = [ {'title': 'Tidal', 'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'year': 1996}, {'title': 'Harbinger', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1994}, {'title': 'This Fire', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1997} ] # Initialize results search_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_albums': target_albums, 'artist_searches': [], 'reviews_found': [] } # Request headers headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print("=== STEP 1: FIRST INSPECT EXISTING DOWNLOADED FILES ===\n") # Check what files we already have in workspace workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if file.endswith('.html') and 'christgau' in file: workspace_files.append(file) print(f"Found existing file: {file}") print(f"\nExisting Christgau files: {len(workspace_files)}") # If we have the get_artist.html file, let's inspect it first get_artist_file = None for file in workspace_files: if 'get_artist' in file: get_artist_file = f'workspace/{file}' break if get_artist_file and os.path.exists(get_artist_file): print(f"\nInspecting search form structure: {get_artist_file}") with open(get_artist_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: form_content = f.read() form_soup = BeautifulSoup(form_content, 'html.parser') # Look for forms and their structure forms = form_soup.find_all('form') print(f"Forms found in get_artist.php: {len(forms)}") for i, form in enumerate(forms): action = form.get('action', 'No action') method = form.get('method', 'GET') print(f"\n Form {i+1}:") print(f" Action: {action}") print(f" Method: {method}") # Get all inputs inputs = form.find_all('input') selects = form.find_all('select') print(f" Inputs: {len(inputs)}") for inp in inputs: name = inp.get('name', 'No name') inp_type = inp.get('type', 'text') value = inp.get('value', '') print(f" - {name} (type: {inp_type}, value: '{value}')") print(f" Selects: {len(selects)}") for sel in selects: name = sel.get('name', 'No name') options = sel.find_all('option') print(f" - {name} ({len(options)} options)") for opt in options[:3]: # Show first 3 options value = opt.get('value', '') text = opt.get_text().strip() print(f" * {value}: {text}") # Look for any text that might give us clues about how to search page_text = form_soup.get_text() print(f"\nPage content preview (first 300 chars):") print(page_text[:300] + "..." if len(page_text) > 300 else page_text) print("\n=== STEP 2: PERFORM TARGETED ARTIST SEARCHES ===\n") # Get unique artists from our target albums unique_artists = list(set([album['artist'] for album in target_albums])) print(f"Artists to search: {unique_artists}") for artist in unique_artists: print(f"\n--- Searching for: {artist} ---") # Try different search approaches search_urls = [ f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name={quote_plus(artist)}", f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?artist={quote_plus(artist)}", f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php?k={quote_plus(artist)}" ] artist_results = { 'artist': artist, 'search_attempts': [], 'reviews_found': [], 'success': False } for search_url in search_urls: print(f"\nTrying: {search_url}") try: response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f"Status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print("âœ“ Search request successful") # Save the search results safe_artist = artist.replace(' ', '_').replace('.', '') search_file = f'workspace/christgau_search_{safe_artist}_{int(time.time())}.html' with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Search results saved to: {search_file}") print(f"Content length: {len(response.text)} characters") # Analyze the search results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') content_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Check if this looks like actual search results (not just the search form) has_results = any(keyword in content_text for keyword in [ 'consumer guide', 'album', 'review', 'grade', artist.lower() ]) print(f"Contains search results: {has_results}") if has_results: print("*** SEARCH RESULTS FOUND ***") # Look for our target albums in the results albums_for_artist = [a for a in target_albums if a['artist'] == artist] for album in albums_for_artist: print(f"\n Looking for album: {album['title']} ({album['year']})") # Search patterns for this album album_patterns = [ album['title'].lower(), f"{album['title'].lower()} {album['year']}", f"{album['year']} {album['title'].lower()}" ] album_found = False review_contexts = [] for pattern in album_patterns: if pattern in content_text: print(f" âœ“ Found album pattern: '{pattern}'") album_found = True # Extract context around the match match_pos = content_text.find(pattern) if match_pos != -1: # Get context (300 chars before and after) start = max(0, match_pos - 300) end = min(len(response.text), match_pos + len(pattern) + 300) context = response.text[start:end].strip() # Look for grades in the context grade_pattern = r'\b([A-E][+-]?)\b' potential_grades = re.findall(grade_pattern, context, re.IGNORECASE) # Filter for valid Christgau grades valid_grades = [] for grade in potential_grades: if grade.upper() in ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-']: valid_grades.append(grade.upper()) context_info = { 'pattern_matched': pattern, 'context': context, 'grades_found': list(set(valid_grades)), 'position': match_pos } review_contexts.append(context_info) print(f" Context preview: {context[:150]}...") if valid_grades: print(f" Grades found: {valid_grades}") if album_found: # Compile review information review_info = { 'album': album['title'], 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'search_url': search_url, 'source_file': search_file, 'review_contexts': review_contexts, 'grades_found': list(set([g for ctx in review_contexts for g in ctx['grades_found']])), 'has_grade': len([g for ctx in review_contexts for g in ctx['grades_found']]) > 0 } artist_results['reviews_found'].append(review_info) search_results['reviews_found'].append(review_info) print(f" *** ALBUM REVIEW FOUND ***") print(f" Final grades: {review_info['grades_found']}") else: print(f" Album not found in search results") artist_results['success'] = len(artist_results['reviews_found']) > 0 artist_results['search_attempts'].append({ 'url': search_url, 'status': 'success', 'file_saved': search_file, 'has_results': has_results }) else: print(f"âœ— Search failed: HTTP {response.status_code}") artist_results['search_attempts'].append({ 'url': search_url, 'status': 'failed', 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f"âœ— Search error: {str(e)}") artist_results['search_attempts'].append({ 'url': search_url, 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) time.sleep(2) # Be respectful search_results['artist_searches'].append(artist_results) print(f"\nArtist search complete: {artist}") print(f"Reviews found: {len(artist_results['reviews_found'])}") print("-" * 50) print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total artists searched: {len(search_results['artist_searches'])}") print(f"Total reviews found: {len(search_results['reviews_found'])}") print("\n--- DETAILED ALBUM RESULTS ---\n") for album in target_albums: print(f"ðŸ“€ {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") # Find reviews for this specific album album_reviews = [r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: print(f" âœ… REVIEW FOUND") print(f" Source: {review['search_url']}") print(f" File: {review['source_file']}") if review['has_grade']: print(f" ðŸŽ¯ CHRISTGAU GRADE(S): {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") # Show best context with grade graded_contexts = [ctx for ctx in review['review_contexts'] if ctx['grades_found']] if graded_contexts: best_context = graded_contexts[0] print(f" Review excerpt: {best_context['context'][:200]}...") else: print(f" ðŸ“ Review mentioned but no clear letter grade found") if review['review_contexts']: print(f" Context: {review['review_contexts'][0]['context'][:200]}...") else: print(f" âŒ NO REVIEW FOUND") print(f" Status: Not reviewed by Christgau (or not found in search)") print() # Save comprehensive results results_file = 'workspace/christgau_comprehensive_search.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2) print(f"Complete search results saved to: {results_file}") # Create final summary report summary_lines = [ "ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS - COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS", "=" * 65, f"Search completed: {search_results['search_timestamp']}", f"Artists searched: {len(unique_artists)} ({', '.join(unique_artists)})", f"Total reviews found: {len(search_results['reviews_found'])}", "", "FINAL RESULTS BY ALBUM:", "-" * 25 ] for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] summary_lines.append(f"\n{album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: summary_lines.append(f" âœ… CHRISTGAU REVIEW: FOUND") if review['has_grade']: summary_lines.append(f" ðŸŽ¯ GRADE: {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") else: summary_lines.append(f" ðŸ“ GRADE: MENTIONED BUT NO CLEAR GRADE") summary_lines.append(f" ðŸ“ SOURCE: {review['source_file']}") else: summary_lines.append(f" âŒ CHRISTGAU REVIEW: NOT FOUND") summary_lines.append(f" ðŸ“ GRADE: NO REVIEW = NO GRADE") summary_lines.extend([ "", "=" * 65, "CONCLUSION:", "Albums WITH Christgau grades: " + str(len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['has_grade']])), "Albums WITHOUT Christgau grades: " + str(len(target_albums) - len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['has_grade']])), "", "Search methodology: Direct artist queries using Christgau's search forms", "Grade detection: Pattern matching for A+ through E- letter grades", "Confidence level: High (official Christgau website sources)" ]) summary_file = 'workspace/christgau_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write('\n'.join(summary_lines)) print(f"Final summary report saved to: {summary_file}") print("\n=== CHRISTGAU SEARCH COMPLETE ===") print("\nKey findings:") print(f"- Albums found with grades: {len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['has_grade']])}") print(f"- Albums found without clear grades: {len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if not r['has_grade']])}") print(f"- Albums not found at all: {len(target_albums) - len(search_results['reviews_found'])}")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code encountered a NameError: 'content_text' is not defined during the search analysis phase. The script successfully accessed Christgau's website (multiple 200 status responses) and saved 6 HTML files to workspace, but failed when trying to analyze the search results due to a variable scoping issue. The error occurred in the content analysis loop where 'content_text' was referenced before being properly defined. **PLAN** alignment: 40% - successfully accessed Christgau sources and saved search result files, but failed to extract any review data due to the execution error. The script shows it found search forms and was attempting targeted artist searches, but the analysis never completed. Recommended fix: Define 'content_text = soup.get_text().lower()' before the 'has_results' check in the search analysis section, and ensure all variables are properly initialized before use in the content analysis loops.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re from urllib.parse import urlencode, quote_plus # Create workspace directory if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== CHRISTGAU TARGETED ARTIST SEARCH ===\n") print("Strategy: Use search forms to directly query for artists") print("Target Artists: Fiona Apple, Paula Cole") print("Target Albums:") print("1. 'Tidal' by Fiona Apple (1996)") print("2. 'Harbinger' by Paula Cole (1994)") print("3. 'This Fire' by Paula Cole (1997)\n") # Define search targets target_albums = [ {'title': 'Tidal', 'artist': 'Fiona Apple', 'year': 1996}, {'title': 'Harbinger', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1994}, {'title': 'This Fire', 'artist': 'Paula Cole', 'year': 1997} ] # Initialize results search_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_albums': target_albums, 'artist_searches': [], 'reviews_found': [] } # Request headers headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print("=== STEP 1: FIRST INSPECT EXISTING DOWNLOADED FILES ===\n") # Check what files we already have in workspace workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if file.endswith('.html') and 'christgau' in file: workspace_files.append(file) print(f"Found existing file: {file}") print(f"\nExisting Christgau files: {len(workspace_files)}") # If we have the get_artist.html file, let's inspect it first get_artist_file = None for file in workspace_files: if 'get_artist' in file: get_artist_file = f'workspace/{file}' break if get_artist_file and os.path.exists(get_artist_file): print(f"\nInspecting search form structure: {get_artist_file}") with open(get_artist_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: form_content = f.read() form_soup = BeautifulSoup(form_content, 'html.parser') # Look for forms and their structure forms = form_soup.find_all('form') print(f"Forms found in get_artist.php: {len(forms)}") for i, form in enumerate(forms): action = form.get('action', 'No action') method = form.get('method', 'GET') print(f"\n Form {i+1}:") print(f" Action: {action}") print(f" Method: {method}") # Get all inputs inputs = form.find_all('input') selects = form.find_all('select') print(f" Inputs: {len(inputs)}") for inp in inputs: name = inp.get('name', 'No name') inp_type = inp.get('type', 'text') value = inp.get('value', '') print(f" - {name} (type: {inp_type}, value: '{value}')") print(f" Selects: {len(selects)}") for sel in selects: name = sel.get('name', 'No name') options = sel.find_all('option') print(f" - {name} ({len(options)} options)") for opt in options[:3]: # Show first 3 options value = opt.get('value', '') text = opt.get_text().strip() print(f" * {value}: {text}") # Look for any text that might give us clues about how to search page_text = form_soup.get_text() print(f"\nPage content preview (first 300 chars):") print(page_text[:300] + "..." if len(page_text) > 300 else page_text) print("\n=== STEP 2: PERFORM TARGETED ARTIST SEARCHES ===\n") # Get unique artists from our target albums unique_artists = list(set([album['artist'] for album in target_albums])) print(f"Artists to search: {unique_artists}") for artist in unique_artists: print(f"\n--- Searching for: {artist} ---") # Try different search approaches search_urls = [ f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name={quote_plus(artist)}", f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?artist={quote_plus(artist)}", f"https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_chap.php?k={quote_plus(artist)}" ] artist_results = { 'artist': artist, 'search_attempts': [], 'reviews_found': [], 'success': False } for search_url in search_urls: print(f"\nTrying: {search_url}") try: response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f"Status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print("âœ“ Search request successful") # Save the search results safe_artist = artist.replace(' ', '_').replace('.', '') search_file = f'workspace/christgau_search_{safe_artist}_{int(time.time())}.html' with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"Search results saved to: {search_file}") print(f"Content length: {len(response.text)} characters") # Analyze the search results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') content_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Check if this looks like actual search results (not just the search form) has_results = any(keyword in content_text for keyword in [ 'consumer guide', 'album', 'review', 'grade', artist.lower() ]) print(f"Contains search results: {has_results}") if has_results: print("*** SEARCH RESULTS FOUND ***") # Look for our target albums in the results albums_for_artist = [a for a in target_albums if a['artist'] == artist] for album in albums_for_artist: print(f"\n Looking for album: {album['title']} ({album['year']})") # Search patterns for this album album_patterns = [ album['title'].lower(), f"{album['title'].lower()} {album['year']}", f"{album['year']} {album['title'].lower()}" ] album_found = False review_contexts = [] for pattern in album_patterns: if pattern in content_text: print(f" âœ“ Found album pattern: '{pattern}'") album_found = True # Extract context around the match match_pos = content_text.find(pattern) if match_pos != -1: # Get context (300 chars before and after) start = max(0, match_pos - 300) end = min(len(response.text), match_pos + len(pattern) + 300) context = response.text[start:end].strip() # Look for grades in the context grade_pattern = r'\b([A-E][+-]?)\b' potential_grades = re.findall(grade_pattern, context, re.IGNORECASE) # Filter for valid Christgau grades valid_grades = [] for grade in potential_grades: if grade.upper() in ['A+', 'A', 'A-', 'B+', 'B', 'B-', 'C+', 'C', 'C-', 'D+', 'D', 'D-', 'E+', 'E', 'E-']: valid_grades.append(grade.upper()) context_info = { 'pattern_matched': pattern, 'context': context, 'grades_found': list(set(valid_grades)), 'position': match_pos } review_contexts.append(context_info) print(f" Context preview: {context[:150]}...") if valid_grades: print(f" Grades found: {valid_grades}") if album_found: # Compile review information review_info = { 'album': album['title'], 'artist': album['artist'], 'year': album['year'], 'search_url': search_url, 'source_file': search_file, 'review_contexts': review_contexts, 'grades_found': list(set([g for ctx in review_contexts for g in ctx['grades_found']])), 'has_grade': len([g for ctx in review_contexts for g in ctx['grades_found']]) > 0 } artist_results['reviews_found'].append(review_info) search_results['reviews_found'].append(review_info) print(f" *** ALBUM REVIEW FOUND ***") print(f" Final grades: {review_info['grades_found']}") else: print(f" Album not found in search results") artist_results['success'] = len(artist_results['reviews_found']) > 0 artist_results['search_attempts'].append({ 'url': search_url, 'status': 'success', 'file_saved': search_file, 'has_results': has_results }) else: print(f"âœ— Search failed: HTTP {response.status_code}") artist_results['search_attempts'].append({ 'url': search_url, 'status': 'failed', 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f"âœ— Search error: {str(e)}") artist_results['search_attempts'].append({ 'url': search_url, 'status': 'error', 'error': str(e) }) time.sleep(2) # Be respectful search_results['artist_searches'].append(artist_results) print(f"\nArtist search complete: {artist}") print(f"Reviews found: {len(artist_results['reviews_found'])}") print("-" * 50) print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total artists searched: {len(search_results['artist_searches'])}") print(f"Total reviews found: {len(search_results['reviews_found'])}") print("\n--- DETAILED ALBUM RESULTS ---\n") for album in target_albums: print(f"ðŸ“€ {album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") # Find reviews for this specific album album_reviews = [r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: print(f" âœ… REVIEW FOUND") print(f" Source: {review['search_url']}") print(f" File: {review['source_file']}") if review['has_grade']: print(f" ðŸŽ¯ CHRISTGAU GRADE(S): {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") # Show best context with grade graded_contexts = [ctx for ctx in review['review_contexts'] if ctx['grades_found']] if graded_contexts: best_context = graded_contexts[0] print(f" Review excerpt: {best_context['context'][:200]}...") else: print(f" ðŸ“ Review mentioned but no clear letter grade found") if review['review_contexts']: print(f" Context: {review['review_contexts'][0]['context'][:200]}...") else: print(f" âŒ NO REVIEW FOUND") print(f" Status: Not reviewed by Christgau (or not found in search)") print() # Save comprehensive results results_file = 'workspace/christgau_comprehensive_search.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2) print(f"Complete search results saved to: {results_file}") # Create final summary report summary_lines = [ "ROBERT CHRISTGAU ALBUM REVIEWS - COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS", "=" * 65, f"Search completed: {search_results['search_timestamp']}", f"Artists searched: {len(unique_artists)} ({', '.join(unique_artists)})", f"Total reviews found: {len(search_results['reviews_found'])}", "", "FINAL RESULTS BY ALBUM:", "-" * 25 ] for album in target_albums: album_reviews = [r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['album'] == album['title'] and r['artist'] == album['artist']] summary_lines.append(f"\n{album['title']} by {album['artist']} ({album['year']})") if album_reviews: for review in album_reviews: summary_lines.append(f" âœ… CHRISTGAU REVIEW: FOUND") if review['has_grade']: summary_lines.append(f" ðŸŽ¯ GRADE: {', '.join(review['grades_found'])}") else: summary_lines.append(f" ðŸ“ GRADE: MENTIONED BUT NO CLEAR GRADE") summary_lines.append(f" ðŸ“ SOURCE: {review['source_file']}") else: summary_lines.append(f" âŒ CHRISTGAU REVIEW: NOT FOUND") summary_lines.append(f" ðŸ“ GRADE: NO REVIEW = NO GRADE") summary_lines.extend([ "", "=" * 65, "CONCLUSION:", "Albums WITH Christgau grades: " + str(len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['has_grade']])), "Albums WITHOUT Christgau grades: " + str(len(target_albums) - len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['has_grade']])), "", "Search methodology: Direct artist queries using Christgau's search forms", "Grade detection: Pattern matching for A+ through E- letter grades", "Confidence level: High (official Christgau website sources)" ]) summary_file = 'workspace/christgau_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write('\n'.join(summary_lines)) print(f"Final summary report saved to: {summary_file}") print("\n=== CHRISTGAU SEARCH COMPLETE ===") print("\nKey findings:") print(f"- Albums found with grades: {len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if r['has_grade']])}") print(f"- Albums found without clear grades: {len([r for r in search_results['reviews_found'] if not r['has_grade']])}") print(f"- Albums not found at all: {len(target_albums) - len(search_results['reviews_found'])}")
Execution Output
Code Output: === CHRISTGAU TARGETED ARTIST SEARCH === Strategy: Use search forms to directly query for artists Target Artists: Fiona Apple, Paula Cole Target Albums: 1.
